original: Dīgha Nikāya 14🔽Mahāpadānasutta
analyzed: dīgha nikāya  mahāpadānasutta
translated: Long Discourses🔽The Great Discourse on the Lineage of Buddhas

original: 1. Pubbenivāsapaṭisaṁyuttakathā
analyzed: pubbenivāsa paṭisayutta kathā
translated: The Discussion of Past Lifetimes

original: Evaṁ me sutaṁ—
analyzed: evam me suta
translated: Thus have I heard.

original: ekaṁ samayaṁ bhagavā sāvatthiyaṁ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme karerikuṭikāyaṁ.
analyzed: ekam samayam bhagavā sāvatthiyam viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme karerikuṭikāya
translated: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Park, in a stilt longhouse.

original: Atha kho sambahulānaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ pacchābhattaṁ piṇḍapātapaṭikkantānaṁ karerimaṇḍalamāḷe sannisinnānaṁ sannipatitānaṁ pubbenivāsapaṭisaṁyuttā dhammī kathā udapādi:
analyzed: atha kho sambahulānam bhikkhūnam pacchābhattam piṇḍapāta paṭikkantānam kareri maṇḍala māḷe sannisinnānam sannipatitānam pubbenivāsa paṭisayuttā dhammī kathā udapādi
translated: After the meal, on his return from alms round, a number of monks sat together in the Kareri hut discussing the topic of past lives:

original: “itipi pubbenivāso, itipi pubbenivāso”ti.
analyzed: iti pi pubbenivāso iti pi pubbenivāso ti
translated: “This is how it was in the past,” “That’s not how it was in the past,” “It was like this in the past,” “It wasn’t like that in the past.”

original: Assosi kho bhagavā dibbāya sotadhātuyā visuddhāya atikkantamānusikāya tesaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ imaṁ kathāsallāpaṁ.
analyzed: assosi kho bhagavā dibbāya sotadhātuyā visuddhāya atikkanta mānusikāya tesam bhikkhūnam imam kathā sallāpa
translated: The Buddha, with his divine hearing-property, which is purified and surpasses the human, heard that discussion topic of those monks.

original: Atha kho bhagavā uṭṭhāyāsanā yena karerimaṇḍalamāḷo tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā paññatte āsane nisīdi, nisajja kho bhagavā bhikkhū āmantesi:
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā uṭṭhāya āsanā yena karerimaṇḍalamāḷo tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā paññatte āsane nisīdi nisajja kho bhagavā bhikkhū āmantesi
translated: Then, rising from his seat, he went to the Kareri hut. He sat down on the prepared seat and said to the monks,

original: “kāya nuttha, bhikkhave, etarahi kathāya sannisinnā; kā ca pana vo antarākathā vippakatā”ti?
analyzed: kāya nuttha bhikkhave etarahi kathāya sannisinnā kā ca pana vaḥ antarākathā vippakatā ati
translated: “What were you sitting talking about just now, monks? What conversation was unfinished when I arrived?”

original: Evaṁ vutte, te bhikkhū bhagavantaṁ etadavocuṁ:
analyzed: evam vutte te bhikkhū bhagavantam etat avocuḥ
translated: When they had finished, they said,

original: “idha, bhante, amhākaṁ pacchābhattaṁ piṇḍapātapaṭikkantānaṁ karerimaṇḍalamāḷe sannisinnānaṁ sannipatitānaṁ pubbenivāsapaṭisaṁyuttā dhammī kathā udapādi:
analyzed: idha bhante amhākam pacchābhattam piṇḍapāta paṭikkantānam kareri maṇḍalamāḷe sannisinnānam sannipatitānam pubbenivāsa paṭisayuttā dhammī kathā udapādi
translated: “Just now, Sir, after our meal, on our return from alms round, we were sitting gathered together here when a discussion sprang up among us concerning past lives:

original: ‘itipi pubbenivāso itipi pubbenivāso’ti.
analyzed: iti pi pubbenivāso iti pi pubbenivāso ti
translated: ‘This is how it is that there are past lives.’

original: Ayaṁ kho no, bhante, antarākathā vippakatā. Atha bhagavā anuppatto”ti.
analyzed: ayam kho naḥ bhante antarākathā vippakatā atha bhagavā anuppatto ti
translated: This was our discussion that was unfinished when the Buddha arrived.”

original: “Iccheyyātha no tumhe, bhikkhave, pubbenivāsapaṭisaṁyuttaṁ dhammiṁ kathaṁ sotun”ti?
analyzed: iccheyyātha no tumhe bhikkhave pubbenivāsa paṭisayuttam dhammim katham sotuṃ ti
translated: “Would you like to hear a teaching about past lives?”

original: “Etassa, bhagavā, kālo; etassa, sugata, kālo;
analyzed: etassa bhagavā kālaḥ etassa sugata kālaḥ
translated: “Now is the time, Blessed One! Now is the time, Holy One!

original: yaṁ bhagavā pubbenivāsapaṭisaṁyuttaṁ dhammiṁ kathaṁ kareyya, bhagavato sutvā bhikkhū dhāressantī”ti.
analyzed: yam bhagavā pubbenivāsa paṭisayuttam dhammim katham kareyya bhagavato sutvā bhikkhū dhāressanti iti
translated: Please teach the monks about past lives. Having heard it from the Buddha, the monks will remember it.”

original: “Tena hi, bhikkhave, suṇātha sādhukaṁ manasi karotha bhāsissāmī”ti.
analyzed: tena hi bhikkhave suṇātha sādhukam manasi karotha bhāsissāmi iti
translated: “Well then, listen & pay close attention. I will speak. ”

original: “Evaṁ, bhante”ti kho te bhikkhū bhagavato paccassosuṁ.
analyzed: eva bhante iti kho te bhikkhū bhagavato
translated: “As you say, lord,” the monks responded.

original: Bhagavā etadavoca:
analyzed: bhagavān etat avoca
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: “Ito so, bhikkhave, ekanavutikappe yaṁ vipassī bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho loke udapādi.🔽Ito so, bhikkhave, ekatiṁse kappe yaṁ sikhī bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho loke udapādi.
analyzed: itas saḥ bhikkhave ekanavuti kappe yam vipassī bhagavā araham sammāsambuddhaḥ loke udapādi  itas saḥ bhikkhave ekatise kappe yam sikhī bhagavā araham sammāsambuddhaḥ loke udapādi
translated: “Monks, ninety-one eons ago the Blessed One, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha Vipassi arose in the world.🔽Thirty-one eons ago the Blessed One, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha Sikhī arose in the world.

original: Tasmiññeva kho, bhikkhave, ekatiṁse kappe vessabhū bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho loke udapādi.🔽Imasmiññeva kho, bhikkhave, bhaddakappe kakusandho bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho loke udapādi.🔽Imasmiññeva kho, bhikkhave, bhaddakappe koṇāgamano bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho loke udapādi.
analyzed: tasmin ñeva kho bhikkhave ekatise kappe vessabhū bhagavā araham sammāsambuddhaḥ loke udapādi  imasmin ñeva kho bhikkhave bhadda kappe kakusandhaḥ bhagavā araham sammāsambuddhaḥ loke udapādi  imasmin ñā eva kho bhikkhave bhaddakappe koṇāgamanaḥ bhagavā araham sammāsambuddhaḥ loke udapādi
translated: In that very same thirty-first eon the Blessed One, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha Vessabhu arose in the world.🔽In this very same auspicious eon the Blessed One, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha Kakusandha arose in the world.🔽In this very same auspicious eon the Blessed One, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha Konāgamana arose in the world.

original: Imasmiññeva kho, bhikkhave, bhaddakappe kassapo bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho loke udapādi.
analyzed: imasmin ñeva kho bhikkhave bhaddakappe kassapaḥ bhagavā araham sammāsambuddhaḥ loke udapādi
translated: In this very same auspicious eon the Blessed One, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha Kassapa arose in the world.

original: Imasmiññeva kho, bhikkhave, bhaddakappe ahaṁ etarahi arahaṁ sammāsambuddho loke uppanno.🔽Vipassī, bhikkhave, bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho khattiyo jātiyā ahosi, khattiyakule udapādi.🔽Sikhī, bhikkhave, bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho khattiyo jātiyā ahosi, khattiyakule udapādi.
analyzed: imasmin ñeva kho bhikkhave bhaddakappe aham etarahi araham sammāsambuddhaḥ loke uppannaḥ  vipassī bhikkhave bhagavā araham sammāsambuddhaḥ khattiyaḥ jātiyā ahosi khattiya kule udapādi  sikhī bhikkhave bhagavā araham sammāsambuddhaḥ khattiyaḥ jātiyā ahosi khattiya kule udapādi
translated: And I, monks, the present Buddha, the present Blessed One, the present Supreme One, the present Teacher of gods and men, the Buddha, the Blessed One, have appeared in the world.🔽The Blessed One Vipassi was of the warrior caste, born in a warrior caste.🔽The Blessed One Sikhi was of the warrior caste, born in a warrior caste.

original: Vessabhū, bhikkhave, bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho khattiyo jātiyā ahosi, khattiyakule udapādi.🔽Kakusandho, bhikkhave, bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho brāhmaṇo jātiyā ahosi, brāhmaṇakule udapādi.
analyzed: vessabhū bhikkhave bhagavā araham sammāsambuddhaḥ khattiyaḥ jātiyā ahosi khattiya kule udapādi  kakusandhaḥ bhikkhave bhagavā araham sammāsambuddhaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ jātiyā ahosi brāhmaṇa kule udapādi
translated: The Blessed One Vessabhu was of the warrior caste, born in a warrior caste.🔽The Blessed One Kakusandha was of the priestly caste, born in a priestly caste.

original: Koṇāgamano, bhikkhave, bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho brāhmaṇo jātiyā ahosi, brāhmaṇakule udapādi.
analyzed: koṇāgamanaḥ bhikkhave bhagavā araham sammāsambuddhaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ jātiyā ahosi brāhmaṇa kule udapādi
translated: The Blessed One Konagamana was of the priestly caste, born in a priestly caste.

original: Kassapo, bhikkhave, bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho brāhmaṇo jātiyā ahosi, brāhmaṇakule udapādi.
analyzed: kassapaḥ bhikkhave bhagavā araham sammāsambuddhaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ jātiyā ahosi brāhmaṇa kule udapādi
translated: The Blessed One Kassapa was of the priestly caste, born in a priestly caste.

original: Ahaṁ, bhikkhave, etarahi arahaṁ sammāsambuddho khattiyo jātiyā ahosiṁ, khattiyakule uppanno.
analyzed: aha bhikkhave etarahi araham sammāsambuddhaḥ khattiyaḥ jātiyā ahosi khattiya kule uppannaḥ
translated: I am a noble warrior by birth, and I was born into a noble warrior family.

original: Vipassī, bhikkhave, bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho koṇḍañño gottena ahosi.🔽Sikhī, bhikkhave, bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho koṇḍañño gottena ahosi.
analyzed: vipassī bhikkhave bhagavā araham sammāsambuddhaḥ koṇḍaññaḥ gottena ahosi  sikhī bhikkhave bhagavā araham sammāsambuddhaḥ koṇḍaññaḥ gottena ahosi
translated: Vipassī was of the Kondanna clan.🔽Sikhī was of the Kondanna clan.

original: Vessabhū, bhikkhave, bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho koṇḍañño gottena ahosi.🔽Kakusandho, bhikkhave, bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho kassapo gottena ahosi.
analyzed: vessabhū bhikkhave bhagavā araham sammāsambuddhaḥ koṇḍaññaḥ gottena ahosi  kakusandhaḥ bhikkhave bhagavā araham sammāsambuddhaḥ kassapaḥ gottena ahosi
translated: Vessabhū was of the Kondanna clan.🔽Kakusandha was of the Kassapa clan.

original: Koṇāgamano, bhikkhave, bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho kassapo gottena ahosi.
analyzed: koṇāgamanaḥ bhikkhave bhagavā araham sammāsambuddho kassapaḥ gottena ahosi
translated: Koṇāgamana was of the Kassapa clan.

original: Kassapo, bhikkhave, bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho kassapo gottena ahosi.
analyzed: kassapaḥ bhikkhave bhagavā araham sammāsambuddhaḥ kassapaḥ gottena ahosi
translated: Kassapa was of the Kassapa clan.

original: Ahaṁ, bhikkhave, etarahi arahaṁ sammāsambuddho gotamo gottena ahosiṁ.
analyzed: aha bhikkhave etarahi araham sammāsambuddhaḥ gotamaḥ gottena ahosi
translated: I am of the Gotama clan.

original: Vipassissa, bhikkhave, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa asītivassasahassāni āyuppamāṇaṁ ahosi.🔽Sikhissa, bhikkhave, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa sattativassasahassāni āyuppamāṇaṁ ahosi.
analyzed: vipassissa bhikkhave bhagavataḥ arahataḥ sammāsambuddhassa asīti vassa sahassāni āyu ppamāṇam ahosi  sikhissa bhikkhave bhagavataḥ arahataḥ sammāsambuddhassa sattati vassa sahassāni āyu ppamāṇam ahosi
translated: Vipassi’s life-span was eighty-four thousand years,🔽Sikhissa’s life-span was seventy thousand years,

original: Vessabhussa, bhikkhave, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa saṭṭhivassasahassāni āyuppamāṇaṁ ahosi.🔽Kakusandhassa, bhikkhave, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa cattālīsavassasahassāni āyuppamāṇaṁ ahosi.
analyzed: vessabhussa bhikkhave bhagavataḥ arahataḥ sammāsambuddhassa saṭṭhi vassa sahassāni āyu ppamāṇam ahosi  kakusandhassa bhikkhave bhagavataḥ arahataḥ sammāsambuddhassa cattālīsa vassa sahassāni āyu ppamāṇam ahosi
translated: Vessabhu’s life-span was sixty thousand years,🔽Kakusandha’s life-span was forty thousand years,

original: Koṇāgamanassa, bhikkhave, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa tiṁsavassasahassāni āyuppamāṇaṁ ahosi.
analyzed: koṇāgamanassa bhikkhave bhagavataḥ arahataḥ sammāsambuddhassa tisa vassa sahassāni āyu ppamāṇam ahosi
translated: Koṇāgamana’s life-span was thirty thousand years,

original: Kassapassa, bhikkhave, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa vīsativassasahassāni āyuppamāṇaṁ ahosi.
analyzed: kassapassa bhikkhave bhagavataḥ arahataḥ sammāsambuddhassa vīsati vassa sahassāni āyu ppamāṇam ahosi
translated: Kassapa’s life-span was twenty thousand years,

original: Mayhaṁ, bhikkhave, etarahi appakaṁ āyuppamāṇaṁ parittaṁ lahukaṁ; yo ciraṁ jīvati, so vassasataṁ appaṁ vā bhiyyo.🔽Vipassī, bhikkhave, bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho pāṭaliyā mūle abhisambuddho.
analyzed: bhikkhave etarahi appakam āyu ppamāṇam parittam yo ciram jīvati saḥ vassa satam appam vā bhiyyas  vipassī bhikkhave bhagavā araham sammāsambuddhaḥ pāṭaliyā mūle abhisambuddhaḥ
translated: I have a short life span, bhikkhus, a short life at most, and I live out my days. One who lives long lives a hundred years or a little more.🔽The Blessed One Vipassi, bhikkhus, fully awakened to the unsurpassed perfect enlightenment at the foot of a trumpet-flower tree.

original: Sikhī, bhikkhave, bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho puṇḍarīkassa mūle abhisambuddho.🔽Vessabhū, bhikkhave, bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho sālassa mūle abhisambuddho.
analyzed: sikhī bhikkhave bhagavā araham sammāsambuddhaḥ puṇḍarīkassa mūle abhisambuddho  vessabhū bhikkhave bhagavā araham sammāsambuddhaḥ sālassa mūle abhisambuddho
translated: The Blessed One SikhI, bhikkhus, fully awakened to the unsurpassed perfect enlightenment at the foot of a white lotus tree.🔽The Blessed One Vessabhu, bhikkhus, fully awakened to the unsurpassed perfect enlightenment at the foot of a sala tree.

original: Kakusandho, bhikkhave, bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho sirīsassa mūle abhisambuddho.
analyzed: kakusandhaḥ bhikkhave bhagavā araham sammāsambuddhaḥ sirīsassa mūle abhisambuddhaḥ
translated: The Blessed One Kakusandha, bhikkhus, fully awakened to the unsurpassed perfect enlightenment at the foot of a sirisa tree.

original: Koṇāgamano, bhikkhave, bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho udumbarassa mūle abhisambuddho.
analyzed: koṇāgamanaḥ bhikkhave bhagavā araham sammāsambuddhaḥ udumbarassa mūle abhisambuddhaḥ
translated: The Blessed One Konagamana, bhikkhus, fully awakened to the unsurpassed perfect enlightenment at the foot of an udumbara tree.

original: Kassapo, bhikkhave, bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho nigrodhassa mūle abhisambuddho.
analyzed: kassapaḥ bhikkhave bhagavā arahan sammāsambuddhaḥ nigrodhassa mūle abhisambuddhaḥ
translated: The Blessed One Kassapa, bhikkhus, fully awakened to the unsurpassed perfect enlightenment at the foot of an acacia tree.

original: Ahaṁ, bhikkhave, etarahi arahaṁ sammāsambuddho assatthassa mūle abhisambuddho.
analyzed: aha bhikkhave etarahi araham sammāsambuddhaḥ assatthassa mūle abhisambuddhaḥ
translated: I, bhikkhus, fully awakened to the unsurpassed perfect enlightenment at the foot of an assattha tree.

original: Vipassissa, bhikkhave, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa khaṇḍatissaṁ nāma sāvakayugaṁ ahosi aggaṁ bhaddayugaṁ.
analyzed: vipassissa bhikkhave bhagavataḥ arahataḥ sammāsambuddhassa khaṇḍatissam nāma sāvaka yugam ahosi aggam bhadda yuga
translated: Vipassi’s pair of chief disciples was called Khanda and Tissa;

original: Sikhissa, bhikkhave, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa abhibhūsambhavaṁ nāma sāvakayugaṁ ahosi aggaṁ bhaddayugaṁ.🔽Vessabhussa, bhikkhave, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa soṇuttaraṁ nāma sāvakayugaṁ ahosi aggaṁ bhaddayugaṁ.
analyzed: sikhissa bhikkhave bhagavataḥ arahataḥ sammāsambuddhassa abhibhūsambhavam nāma sāvaka yugam ahosi aggam bhadda yuga  vessabhussa bhikkhave bhagavataḥ arahataḥ sammāsambuddhassa soṇuttaram nāma sāvaka yugam ahosi aggam bhadda yuga
translated: Sikhi’s pair of chief disciples was called Abhibhu and Sambhava;🔽Vessabhu’s pair of chief disciples was called Sonuttara and Uttara;

original: Kakusandhassa, bhikkhave, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa vidhurasañjīvaṁ nāma sāvakayugaṁ ahosi aggaṁ bhaddayugaṁ.
analyzed: kakusandhassa bhikkhave bhagavataḥ arahataḥ sammāsambuddhassa vidhurasañjīvam nāma sāvaka yugam ahosi aggam bhadda yuga
translated: Kakusandha’s pair of chief disciples was called Vidhura and Sanjiva;

original: Koṇāgamanassa, bhikkhave, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa bhiyyosuttaraṁ nāma sāvakayugaṁ ahosi aggaṁ bhaddayugaṁ.
analyzed: koṇāgamanassa bhikkhave bhagavataḥ arahataḥ sammāsambuddhassa bhiyyosuttaram nāma sāvaka yugam ahosi aggam bhadda yuga
translated: Konagamana’s pair of chief disciples was called Bhiya and Uttara;

original: Kassapassa, bhikkhave, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa tissabhāradvājaṁ nāma sāvakayugaṁ ahosi aggaṁ bhaddayugaṁ.
analyzed: kassapassa bhikkhave bhagavataḥ arahataḥ sammāsambuddhassa tissabhāradvājam nāma sāvaka yugam ahosi aggam bhadda yuga
translated: Kassapa’s pair of chief disciples was called Tisya and Bharadvaja.

original: Mayhaṁ, bhikkhave, etarahi sāriputtamoggallānaṁ nāma sāvakayugaṁ ahosi aggaṁ bhaddayugaṁ.🔽Vipassissa, bhikkhave, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa tayo sāvakānaṁ sannipātā🔽ahesuṁ. Eko sāvakānaṁ sannipāto ahosi aṭṭhasaṭṭhibhikkhusatasahassaṁ, eko sāvakānaṁ
analyzed: bhikkhave etarahi sāriputta moggallānam nāma sāvaka yugam ahosi aggam bhaddayuga  vipassissa bhikkhave bhagavataḥ arahataḥ sammāsambuddhassa tayo sāvakānam sannipātā  ekaḥ sāvakānam sannipātaḥ ahosi aṭṭhasaṭṭhi bhikkhu sata sahasse ekaḥ sāvakāna
translated: I now have a pair of disciples, Sariputta and Moggallana, who are chief among my disciples.

original: sannipāto ahosi bhikkhusatasahassaṁ, eko sāvakānaṁ sannipāto ahosi asītibhikkhusahassāni.🔽Vipassissa, bhikkhave, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa ime tayo sāvakānaṁ sannipātā
analyzed: sannipātaḥ ahosi bhikkhu sata sahassaḥ ekaḥ sāvakānam sannipātaḥ ahosi asīti bhikkhu sahassāni  vipassissa bhikkhave bhagavataḥ arahataḥ sammāsambuddhassa ime tayo sāvakānam sannipātā
translated: Vipassi had three assemblies of disciples: one of 6,800,000 disciples, one of 600,000, and one of 500,000.

original: ahesuṁ sabbesaṁyeva khīṇāsavānaṁ.🔽Sikhissa, bhikkhave, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa tayo sāvakānaṁ sannipātā
analyzed: ahesum sabbesayā iva khīṇa āsavāna  sikhissa bhikkhave bhagavataḥ arahataḥ sammāsambuddhassa tayo sāvakānam sannipātā
translated: All of them were arahats.

original: ahesuṁ. Eko sāvakānaṁ sannipāto ahosi bhikkhusatasahassaṁ, eko sāvakānaṁ sannipāto
analyzed: ekaḥ sāvakānam sannipātaḥ ahosi bhikkhu sata sahasse ekaḥ sāvakānam sannipātaḥ
translated: SikhI had three assemblies of disciples: one of 100,000, one of 90,000, and one of 80,000.🔽All of them were arahats.

original: ahosi asītibhikkhusahassāni, eko sāvakānaṁ sannipāto ahosi sattatibhikkhusahassāni.
analyzed: ahosi asīti bhikkhu sahassāni ekaḥ sāvakānam sannipātaḥ ahosi sattati bhikkhu sahassāni
translated: there were eighty thousand monks. This was the first assembly of disciples. There was another assembly of seventy thousand monks. This was the second assembly of disciples. There was another assembly of sixty thousand monks. This was the third assembly of disciples.

original: Sikhissa, bhikkhave, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa ime tayo sāvakānaṁ sannipātā
analyzed: sikhissa bhikkhave bhagavataḥ arahataḥ sammāsambuddhassa ime tayo sāvakānam sannipātā
translated: These were the three assemblies of Sikhi the Accomplished One, the Worthy One, the Perfect Sambuddha,

original: ahesuṁ sabbesaṁyeva khīṇāsavānaṁ.
analyzed: ahesum sabbesayā iva khīṇa āsavāna
translated: all of whom were perfected ones.

original: Vessabhussa, bhikkhave, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa tayo sāvakānaṁ sannipātā
analyzed: vessabhussa bhikkhave bhagavataḥ arahataḥ sammāsambuddhassa tayo sāvakānam sannipātā
translated: Vessabhu the Accomplished One, the Worthy One, the Perfect Sambuddha, had three assemblies of disciples.

original: ahesuṁ. Eko sāvakānaṁ sannipāto ahosi asītibhikkhusahassāni, eko sāvakānaṁ sannipāto
analyzed: ekaḥ sāvakānam sannipātaḥ ahosi asīti bhikkhu sahassāni ekaḥ sāvakānam sannipātaḥ
translated: There was an assembly of eighty thousand monks. This was the first assembly of disciples.🔽There was an assembly of seventy thousand monks. This was the second assembly of disciples.

original: ahosi sattatibhikkhusahassāni, eko sāvakānaṁ sannipāto ahosi saṭṭhibhikkhusahassāni.
analyzed: ahosi sattati bhikkhu sahassāni ekaḥ sāvakānam sannipātaḥ ahosi saṭṭhi bhikkhu sahassāni
translated: There was an assembly of sixty thousand monks. This was the third assembly of disciples.

original: Vessabhussa, bhikkhave, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa ime tayo sāvakānaṁ sannipātā
analyzed: vessabhussa bhikkhave bhagavataḥ arahataḥ sammāsambuddhassa ime tayo sāvakānam sannipātā
translated: These were the three assemblies of Vessabhu the Accomplished One, the Worthy One, the Perfect Sambuddha,

original: ahesuṁ sabbesaṁyeva khīṇāsavānaṁ.
analyzed: ahesum sabbesayā iva khīṇa āsavāna
translated: all of whom were perfected ones.

original: Kakusandhassa, bhikkhave, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa eko sāvakānaṁ sannipāto
analyzed: kakusandhassa bhikkhave bhagavataḥ arahataḥ sammāsambuddhassa ekaḥ sāvakānam sannipātaḥ
translated: Kakusandha the Accomplished One, the Worthy One, the Perfect Sambuddha, had one assembly of disciples,

original: ahosi cattālīsabhikkhusahassāni. Kakusandhassa, bhikkhave, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa
analyzed: ahosi cattālīsa bhikkhu sahassāni kakusandhassa bhikkhave bhagavataḥ arahataḥ sammāsambuddhassa
translated: there were forty thousand monks. Kakusandha, the Blessed One, accomplished and fully enlightened,

original: ayaṁ eko sāvakānaṁ sannipāto ahosi sabbesaṁyeva khīṇāsavānaṁ.
analyzed: ayam ekaḥ sāvakānam sannipātaḥ ahosi
translated: had one assembly of his disciples, all of them arahants.

original: Koṇāgamanassa, bhikkhave, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa eko sāvakānaṁ sannipāto
analyzed: koṇāgamanassa bhikkhave bhagavataḥ arahataḥ sammāsambuddhassa ekaḥ sāvakānam sannipātaḥ
translated: Koṇāgamana, the Blessed One, accomplished and fully enlightened, had one assembly of his disciples

original: ahosi tiṁsabhikkhusahassāni. Koṇāgamanassa, bhikkhave, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa
analyzed: ahosi tisa bhikkhu sahassāni koṇāgamanassa bhikkhave bhagavataḥ arahataḥ sammāsambuddhassa
translated: consisting of thirty thousand monks. Koṇāgamana, the Blessed One, accomplished and fully enlightened,

original: ayaṁ eko sāvakānaṁ sannipāto ahosi sabbesaṁyeva khīṇāsavānaṁ.
analyzed: ayam ekaḥ sāvakānam sannipātaḥ ahosi
translated: had one assembly of his disciples, all of them arahants.

original: Kassapassa, bhikkhave, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa eko sāvakānaṁ sannipāto
analyzed: kassapassa bhikkhave bhagavataḥ arahataḥ sammāsambuddhassa ekaḥ sāvakānam sannipātaḥ
translated: Kassapa, the Blessed One, accomplished and fully enlightened, had one assembly of his disciples

original: ahosi vīsatibhikkhusahassāni. Kassapassa, bhikkhave, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa
analyzed: ahosi vīsati bhikkhu sahassāni kassapassa bhikkhave bhagavataḥ arahataḥ sammāsambuddhassa
translated: consisting of twenty thousand monks. Kassapa, the Blessed One, accomplished and fully enlightened,

original: ayaṁ eko sāvakānaṁ sannipāto ahosi sabbesaṁyeva khīṇāsavānaṁ.
analyzed: ayam ekaḥ sāvakānam sannipātaḥ ahosi
translated: had one assembly of his disciples, all of them arahants.

original: Mayhaṁ, bhikkhave, etarahi eko sāvakānaṁ sannipāto ahosi aḍḍhateḷasāni bhikkhusatāni. Mayhaṁ, bhikkhave, ayaṁ eko sāvakānaṁ sannipāto ahosi sabbesaṁyeva khīṇāsavānaṁ.
analyzed: bhikkhave etarahi ekaḥ sāvakānam sannipātaḥ ahosi aḍḍhateḷasāni bhikkhu satāni bhikkhave ayam ekaḥ sāvakānam sannipātaḥ ahosi khīṇāsavānam
translated: Now I have had one gathering of disciples, of more than 1,250 monks, all of them perfected ones.

original: Vipassissa, bhikkhave, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa asoko nāma bhikkhu upaṭṭhāko ahosi aggupaṭṭhāko.
analyzed: vipassissa bhikkhave bhagavataḥ arahataḥ sammāsambuddhassa asokaḥ nāma bhikkhu upaṭṭhākaḥ ahosi aggupaṭṭhāko
translated: The monk named Asoka was the attendant of the Blessed One, the perfected one, the fully awakened Vipassi, and he was the best of his attendants.

original: Sikhissa, bhikkhave, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa khemaṅkaro nāma bhikkhu upaṭṭhāko ahosi aggupaṭṭhāko.
analyzed: sikhissa bhikkhave bhagavataḥ arahataḥ sammāsambuddhassa khemaṅkaraḥ nāma bhikkhu upaṭṭhākaḥ ahosi aggupaṭṭhāko
translated: The monk named Khemankara was the attendant of the Blessed One, the perfected one, the fully awakened Sikhi, and he was the best of his attendants.

original: Vessabhussa, bhikkhave, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa upasanto nāma bhikkhu upaṭṭhāko ahosi aggupaṭṭhāko.
analyzed: vessabhussa bhikkhave bhagavataḥ arahataḥ sammāsambuddhassa upasantaḥ nāma bhikkhu upaṭṭhākaḥ ahosi agga upaṭṭhāko
translated: The monk named Upasanto was the attendant of the Blessed One, the perfected one, the fully awakened Vessabhu, and he was the best of his attendants.

original: Kakusandhassa, bhikkhave, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa buddhijo nāma bhikkhu upaṭṭhāko ahosi aggupaṭṭhāko.
analyzed: kakusandhassa bhikkhave bhagavataḥ arahataḥ sammāsambuddhassa buddhijaḥ nāma bhikkhu upaṭṭhākaḥ ahosi aggupaṭṭhāko
translated: The monk named Buddhija was the attendant of the Blessed One, the perfected one, the fully awakened Kakusandha, and he was the best of his attendants.

original: Koṇāgamanassa, bhikkhave, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa sotthijo nāma bhikkhu upaṭṭhāko ahosi aggupaṭṭhāko.
analyzed: koṇāgamanassa bhikkhave bhagavataḥ arahataḥ sammāsambuddhassa sotthijaḥ nāma bhikkhu upaṭṭhākaḥ ahosi aggupaṭṭhāko
translated: Koṇāgamana had a monastery attendant named Sotthija.

original: Kassapassa, bhikkhave, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa sabbamitto nāma bhikkhu upaṭṭhāko ahosi aggupaṭṭhāko.
analyzed: kassapassa bhikkhave bhagavataḥ arahataḥ sammāsambuddhassa sabbamittaḥ nāma bhikkhu upaṭṭhākaḥ ahosi aggupaṭṭhāko
translated: Kassapa had a monastery attendant named Sabbamitta.

original: Mayhaṁ, bhikkhave, etarahi ānando nāma bhikkhu upaṭṭhāko ahosi aggupaṭṭhāko.
analyzed: bhikkhave etarahi ānandaḥ nāma bhikkhu upaṭṭhākaḥ ahosi agga upaṭṭhāko
translated: I have a monastery attendant named Ānanda.

original: Vipassissa, bhikkhave, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa bandhumā nāma rājā pitā ahosi.
analyzed: vipassissa bhikkhave bhagavataḥ arahataḥ sammāsambuddhassa bandhumā nāma rājā pitā ahosi
translated: Vipassī had a father named Bandhuma, a king of Bandhumatī.

original: Bandhumatī nāma devī mātā ahosi janetti.
analyzed: bandhumatī nāma devī mātā
translated: His mother was Queen Bandhumatī, and she gave birth to him.

original: Bandhumassa rañño bandhumatī nāma nagaraṁ rājadhānī ahosi.
analyzed: bandhumassa raññaḥ bandhumatī nāma nagaram rājadhānī ahosi
translated: Bandhuma’s capital was Bandhumatī.

original: Sikhissa, bhikkhave, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa aruṇo nāma rājā pitā ahosi.
analyzed: sikhissa bhikkhave bhagavataḥ arahataḥ sammāsambuddhassa aruṇaḥ nāma rājā pitā ahosi
translated: Sikhī had a father named Aruṇa, a king of Aruṇavatī.

original: Pabhāvatī nāma devī mātā ahosi janetti.
analyzed: pabhāvatī nāma devī mātā ahosi jana itti
translated: His mother was Queen Pabhāvatī, and she gave birth to him.

original: Aruṇassa rañño aruṇavatī nāma nagaraṁ rājadhānī ahosi.
analyzed: aruṇassa raññaḥ aruṇavatī nāma nagaram rājadhānī ahosi
translated: Aruṇa’s capital was Aruṇavatī.

original: Vessabhussa, bhikkhave, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa suppatito nāma rājā pitā ahosi.
analyzed: vessabhussa bhikkhave bhagavataḥ arahataḥ sammāsambuddhassa suppatitaḥ nāma rājā pitā ahosi
translated: Vessabhū’s father was King Suppatit.

original: Vassavatī nāma devī mātā ahosi janetti.
analyzed: vassavatī nāma devī mātā ahosi janetti
translated: His mother was Queen Vassavatī.

original: Suppatitassa rañño anomaṁ nāma nagaraṁ rājadhānī ahosi.
analyzed: suppatitassa raññaḥ anomam nāma nagaram rājadhānī ahosi
translated: His capital was Anoma.

original: Kakusandhassa, bhikkhave, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa aggidatto nāma brāhmaṇo pitā ahosi.
analyzed: kakusandhassa bhikkhave bhagavataḥ arahataḥ sammāsambuddhassa aggidattaḥ nāma brāhmaṇaḥ pitā ahosi
translated: Kakusandha’s father was the brahmin Aggidatta.

original: Visākhā nāma brāhmaṇī mātā ahosi janetti.🔽Tena kho pana, bhikkhave, samayena khemo nāma rājā ahosi.
analyzed: visākhā nāma brāhmaṇī mātā  tena kho pana bhikkhave samayena khemaḥ nāma rājā ahosi
translated: His mother was the brahmin lady Visākhā.🔽At that time there was a king named Khema.

original: Khemassa rañño khemavatī nāma nagaraṁ rājadhānī ahosi.
analyzed: khemassa raññaḥ khemavatī nāma nagaram rājadhānī ahosi
translated: His capital was Khemavatī.

original: Koṇāgamanassa, bhikkhave, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa yaññadatto nāma brāhmaṇo pitā ahosi.
analyzed: koṇāgamanassa bhikkhave bhagavataḥ arahataḥ sammāsambuddhassa yaññadattaḥ nāma brāhmaṇaḥ pitā ahosi
translated: Koṇāgamana’s father was the brahmin Yaññadatta.

original: Uttarā nāma brāhmaṇī mātā ahosi janetti.🔽Tena kho pana, bhikkhave, samayena sobho nāma rājā ahosi.
analyzed: uttarā nāma brāhmaṇī mātā  tena kho pana bhikkhave samayena sobhaḥ nāma rājā ahosi
translated: His mother was the brahmin lady Uttarā.🔽At that time there was a king named Sobha.

original: Sobhassa rañño sobhavatī nāma nagaraṁ rājadhānī ahosi.
analyzed: sobhassa raññaḥ sobhavatī nāma nagaram rājadhānī ahosi
translated: His capital was Sobhavatī.

original: Kassapassa, bhikkhave, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa brahmadatto nāma brāhmaṇo pitā ahosi.
analyzed: kassapassa bhikkhave bhagavataḥ arahataḥ sammāsambuddhassa brahmadattaḥ nāma brāhmaṇaḥ pitā ahosi
translated: Kassapa’s father was the brahmin Brahmadatta.

original: Dhanavatī nāma brāhmaṇī mātā ahosi janetti.
analyzed: dhanavatī nāma brāhmaṇī mātā
translated: His mother was the brahmin lady named Dhanavati.

original: Tena kho pana, bhikkhave, samayena kikī nāma rājā ahosi.
analyzed: tena kho pana bhikkhave samayena kikī nāma rājā ahosi
translated: At that time there was a king named Kiki.

original: Kikissa rañño bārāṇasī nāma nagaraṁ rājadhānī ahosi.
analyzed: kikissa raññaḥ bārāṇasī nāma nagaram rājadhānī ahosi
translated: His capital was the city of Baranasi.

original: Mayhaṁ, bhikkhave, etarahi suddhodano nāma rājā pitā ahosi.
analyzed: bhikkhave etarahi suddhodanaḥ nāma rājā pitā ahosi
translated: My father was King Suddhodana.

original: Māyā nāma devī mātā ahosi janetti.
analyzed: māyā nāma devī mātā ahosi jana itti
translated: My mother was the lady named Maya.

original: Kapilavatthu nāma nagaraṁ rājadhānī ahosī”ti.
analyzed: kapilavatthu nāma nagaram rājadhānī ahosi iti
translated: My capital was the city of Kapilavatthu.”

original: Idamavoca bhagavā.
analyzed: idam avoca bhagavān
translated: This is what the Buddha said.

original: Idaṁ vatvāna sugato uṭṭhāyāsanā vihāraṁ pāvisi.
analyzed: idam vatvāna sugataḥ uṭṭhāya āsanā vihāram pāvisi
translated: And when the Sublime One had said this, the Teacher arose from his seat and went into his dwelling.

original: Atha kho tesaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ acirapakkantassa bhagavato ayamantarākathā udapādi:
analyzed: atha kho tesam bhikkhūnam acira pakkantassa bhagavataḥ ayam antarākathā udapādi
translated: Then, not long after the Blessed One had left, the monks began a discussion:

original: “acchariyaṁ, āvuso, abbhutaṁ, āvuso, tathāgatassa mahiddhikatā mahānubhāvatā.
analyzed: acchariyaḥ āvuso abbhutaḥ āvuso tathāgatassa mahiddhika tā mahā anubhāva tā
translated: “It’s astounding and amazing how powerful and mighty is the Tathagata!

original: Yatra hi nāma tathāgato atīte buddhe parinibbute chinnapapañce chinnavaṭume pariyādinnavaṭṭe
analyzed: yatra hi nāma tathāgataḥ atīte buddhe parinibbute chinna papañce chinna vaṭume pariyādinna vaṭṭe
translated: For the Realised One remembers the Buddhas of the past who have attained Complete Emancipation, cut the cycle of continued existence, cut the cycle of gati, cut the cycle of craving,

original: sabbadukkhavītivatte jātitopi anussarissati, nāmatopi anussarissati, gottatopi anussarissati,
analyzed: sabba dukkha vītivatte jātitaḥ api anussarissati nāmataḥ api anussarissati gottataḥ api anussarissati
translated: who have overcome all suffering, he remembers their births, he remembers their names, he remembers their clans,

original: āyuppamāṇatopi anussarissati, sāvakayugatopi anussarissati, sāvakasannipātatopi anussarissati:
analyzed: āyu ppamāṇataḥ api anussarissati sāvaka yugataḥ api anussarissati sāvaka sannipātataḥ api anussarissati
translated: he remembers their life-spans, he remembers their assemblies of disciples, he remembers their chief disciples,

original: ‘evaṁjaccā te bhagavanto ahesuṁ itipi, evaṁnāmā evaṅgottā evaṁsīlā evaṁdhammā evaṁpaññā evaṁvihārī evaṁvimuttā te bhagavanto ahesuṁ itipī’”ti.
analyzed: eva jaccā te bhagavantaḥ ahesuṃ iti pi eva nāmā evaṃgottāḥ eva sīlāḥ eva dhammāḥ eva paññāḥ eva vihārī eva vimuttā te bhagavantaḥ ahesuṃ iti pi iti
translated: he remembers: ‘Those Fortunate Ones were of such and such virtues, of such and such qualities, of such and such wisdom, of such and such meditative states, of such and such liberations.’“

original: “Kiṁ nu kho, āvuso, tathāgatasseva nu kho esā dhammadhātu suppaṭividdhā, yassā dhammadhātuyā
analyzed: kim nu kho āvuso tathāgatassa iva nu kho esā dhammadhātu su paṭividdhā yassā dhammadhātuyā
translated: “But, friend, is this Dhamma-element only well penetrated by the Realised One,

original: suppaṭividdhattā tathāgato atīte buddhe parinibbute chinnapapañce chinnavaṭume pariyādinnavaṭṭe
analyzed: suppaṭividdha ttā tathāgataḥ atīte buddhe parinibbute chinna papañce chinna vaṭume pariyādinna vaṭṭe
translated: by the penetration of which the Realised One remembers the Buddhas of the past who have attained Complete Emancipation, cut the cycle of continued existence, cut the cycle of gati, cut the cycle of craving,

original: sabbadukkhavītivatte jātitopi anussarati, nāmatopi anussarati, gottatopi anussarati,
analyzed: sabba dukkha vītivatte jātitaḥ api anussarati nāmataḥ api anussarati gottataḥ api anussarati
translated: who have overcome all suffering, he remembers their births, he remembers their names, he remembers their clans,

original: āyuppamāṇatopi anussarati, sāvakayugatopi anussarati, sāvakasannipātatopi anussarati:
analyzed: āyu ppamāṇataḥ api anussarati sāvaka yugataḥ api anussarati sāvaka sannipātataḥ api anussarati
translated: he remembers their lifespans, their disciples, and the assemblies of disciples,🔽saying: ‘Those Fortunate Ones were like this and like that, they had these names, these clans, this conduct, this wisdom,🔽this way of living, this liberation, they had such lifespans, such was their duration as a teacher, such the number of their disciples, such the assemblies of disciples,

original: ‘evaṁjaccā te bhagavanto ahesuṁ itipi, evaṁnāmā evaṅgottā evaṁsīlā evaṁdhammā evaṁpaññā
analyzed: te bhagavantaḥ ahesuṃ iti pi eva nāmāḥ evaṃgottāḥ eva sīlāḥ eva dhammāḥ eva paññā
translated: saying: ‘Those Fortunate Ones were like this and like that, they had these names, these clans, this conduct, this wisdom,

original: evaṁvihārī evaṁvimuttā te bhagavanto ahesuṁ itipī’ti,
analyzed: te bhagavantaḥ ahesuṃ iti pi iti
translated: this way of living, this liberation, they had such lifespans, such was their duration as a teacher, such the number of their disciples, such the assemblies of disciples.’

original: udāhu devatā tathāgatassa etamatthaṁ ārocesuṁ, yena tathāgato atīte buddhe parinibbute🔽chinnapapañce chinnavaṭume pariyādinnavaṭṭe sabbadukkhavītivatte jātitopi anussarati,🔽nāmatopi anussarati, gottatopi anussarati, āyuppamāṇatopi anussarati, sāvakayugatopi
analyzed: udāhu devatā tathāgatassa etam attham ārocesu yena tathāgataḥ atīte buddhe parinibbute  chinna papañce chinna vaṭume pariyādinna vaṭṭe sabba dukkha vītivatte jātitaḥ api anussarati  nāmataḥ api anussarati gottataḥ api anussarati āyu ppamāṇataḥ api anussarati sāvaka yugataḥ api
translated: Or did the Divinities announce this matter to the Realised One, so that the Realised One remembers the Buddhas of the past who have attained Complete Emancipation,🔽who have cut off the pollutants, who have destroyed the pollutants, who have laid down the burden, who have attained their own goal, who have utterly destroyed the fetters of existence, who have attained perfect understanding, who have severed the round (of becoming), who have laid down the instruments (of perception), who have reached the super-knowledge, who are great in wisdom, who are great seers, who are Tamed, Great Nāgas, Supreme Persons, who are Unequaled, who are the Best of Men, who are Teachers of Gods and men, who are the Buddha, the Fortunate One, and he remembers their names, their clans, their lifespans, their disciples,🔽and the assemblies of disciples, saying: ‘Those Fortunate Ones were like this and like that, they had these names, these clans, this conduct, this wisdom,🔽this way of living, this liberation, they had such lifespans, such was their duration as a teacher, such the number of their disciples, such the assemblies of disciples,

original: anussarati, sāvakasannipātatopi anussarati: ‘evaṁjaccā te bhagavanto ahesuṁ itipi,
analyzed: anussarati sāvaka sannipātataḥ pi anussarati evajaccā te bhagavantaḥ ahesuṃ iti pi
translated: saying: ‘Those Fortunate Ones were like this and like that, they had these names, these clans, this conduct, this wisdom,

original: evaṁnāmā evaṅgottā evaṁsīlā evaṁdhammā evaṁpaññā evaṁvihārī evaṁvimuttā te bhagavanto ahesuṁ itipī’”ti.
analyzed: eva nāmā evaṃgottā eva sīlāḥ eva dhammāḥ eva paññāḥ eva vihārī eva vimuttā te bhagavantaḥ ahesuṃ iti pi iti
translated: this way of living, this liberation, they had such lifespans, such was their duration as a teacher, such the number of their disciples, such the assemblies of disciples.’?”

original: Ayañca hidaṁ tesaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ antarākathā vippakatā hoti.
analyzed: ayam ca hidam tesam bhikkhūnam antarākathā vippakatā hoti
translated: But then their discussion remained unfinished.

original: Atha kho bhagavā sāyanhasamayaṁ paṭisallānā vuṭṭhito yena karerimaṇḍalamāḷo tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā paññatte āsane nisīdi.
analyzed: atha kho bhagavā sāyanha samayam paṭisallānā vuṭṭhitaḥ yena karerimaṇḍalamāḷo tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā paññatte āsane nisīdi
translated: Then, in the late afternoon, the Buddha came out from his seclusion and went to the Kareri Round Hall, where he sat down on the prepared seat.

original: Nisajja kho bhagavā bhikkhū āmantesi:
analyzed: nisajja kho bhagavā bhikkhū āmantesi
translated: He addressed the monks:

original: “kāya nuttha, bhikkhave, etarahi kathāya sannisinnā; kā ca pana vo antarākathā vippakatā”ti?
analyzed: kāya nuttha bhikkhave etarahi kathāya sannisinnā kā ca pana vaḥ antarākathā vippakatā ati
translated: “Monks, what were you sitting talking about just now? What was the unfinished discussion?”

original: Evaṁ vutte, te bhikkhū bhagavantaṁ etadavocuṁ:🔽“idha, bhante, amhākaṁ acirapakkantassa bhagavato ayaṁ antarākathā udapādi:🔽‘acchariyaṁ, āvuso, abbhutaṁ, āvuso, tathāgatassa mahiddhikatā mahānubhāvatā.
analyzed: evam vutte te bhikkhū bhagavantam etat avocuḥ  idha bhante amhākam acira pakkantassa bhagavataḥ ayam antarākathā udapādi  acchariyaḥ āvuso abbhutaḥ āvuso tathāgatassa mahiddhika tā mahā anubhāva tā
translated: When he said this, the monks told him what had happened.🔽“It’s astounding and amazing, friends, how the Buddha has realized the great and mighty power of supernormal knowledge.

original: Yatra hi nāma tathāgato atīte buddhe parinibbute chinnapapañce chinnavaṭume pariyādinnavaṭṭe
analyzed: yatra hi nāma tathāgataḥ atīte buddhe parinibbute chinna papañce chinna vaṭume pariyādinna vaṭṭe
translated: For the Buddha has realized the supernormal power of the mind, so that he can recollect his manifold past lives, with features and details.

original: sabbadukkhavītivatte jātitopi anussarissati, nāmatopi anussarissati, gottatopi anussarissati,
analyzed: sabba dukkha vītivatte jātitaḥ api anussarissati nāmataḥ api anussarissati gottataḥ api anussarissati
translated: and will remember their births, their names, their clans,

original: āyuppamāṇatopi anussarissati, sāvakayugatopi anussarissati, sāvakasannipātatopi anussarissati:🔽“evaṁjaccā te bhagavanto ahesuṁ itipi, evaṁnāmā evaṅgottā evaṁsīlā evaṁdhammā evaṁpaññā evaṁvihārī evaṁvimuttā te bhagavanto ahesuṁ itipī”ti.
analyzed: āyu ppamāṇataḥ api anussarissati sāvaka yugataḥ api anussarissati sāvaka sannipātataḥ api anussarissati  eva jaccā te bhagavantaḥ ahesuṃ iti pi eva nāmā evaṃgottāḥ eva sīlāḥ eva dhammāḥ eva paññāḥ eva vihārī eva vimuttā te bhagavantaḥ ahesuṃ iti pi iti
translated: their lifespan, their noble disciples, and their assemblies of disciples,🔽thinking: ‘Those Fortunate Ones were born thus, they had these names, these clans,🔽they had this kind of virtue, this kind of Dhamma, this kind of wisdom, this kind of living, this kind of freedom.’

original: Kiṁ nu kho, āvuso, tathāgatasseva nu kho esā dhammadhātu suppaṭividdhā, yassā dhammadhātuyā🔽suppaṭividdhattā tathāgato atīte buddhe parinibbute chinnapapañce chinnavaṭume pariyādinnavaṭṭe
analyzed: kim nu kho āvuso tathāgatassa iva nu kho esā dhammadhātu su paṭividdhā yassā dhammadhātuyā  suppaṭividdha ttā tathāgataḥ atīte buddhe parinibbute chinna papañce chinna vaṭume pariyādinna vaṭṭe
translated: “But, reverend Sir, is this Dhamma-element only well penetrated by the Realised One,🔽by virtue of which the Realised One remembers his many kinds of previous existences,🔽that is to say: one birth, two, three, four, five, ten, twenty, thirty, forty, fifty,

original: sabbadukkhavītivatte jātitopi anussarati, nāmatopi anussarati, gottatopi anussarati,
analyzed: sabba dukkha vītivatte jātitaḥ api anussarati nāmataḥ api anussarati gottataḥ api anussarati
translated: Translation: and will remember their births, their names, their clans,

original: āyuppamāṇatopi anussarati, sāvakayugatopi anussarati, sāvakasannipātatopi anussarati:
analyzed: āyu ppamāṇataḥ api anussarati sāvaka yugataḥ api anussarati sāvaka sannipātataḥ api anussarati
translated: their lifespan, their noble disciples, and their assemblies of disciples,🔽thinking: ‘Those Fortunate Ones were born thus, they had these names, these clans,🔽they had this kind of virtue, this kind of Dhamma, this kind of wisdom, this kind of living, this kind of freedom.’

original: “evaṁjaccā te bhagavanto ahesuṁ itipi, evaṁnāmā evaṅgottā evaṁsīlā evaṁdhammā evaṁpaññā evaṁvihārī evaṁvimuttā te bhagavanto ahesuṁ itipī”ti.
analyzed: eva jaccā te bhagavantaḥ ahesuṃ iti pi eva nāmā evaṃgottāḥ eva sīlāḥ eva dhammāḥ eva paññāḥ eva vihārī eva vimuttā te bhagavantaḥ ahesuṃ iti pi iti
translated: ‘The Blessed Lord was like this and like that.’

original: Udāhu devatā tathāgatassa etamatthaṁ ārocesuṁ, yena tathāgato atīte buddhe parinibbute
analyzed: udāhu devatā tathāgatassa etam attham ārocesu yena tathāgataḥ atīte buddhe parinibbute
translated: Or did the devas tell the Tathagata, so that he could remember the Buddhas of the past who had attained final Nibbana,

original: chinnapapañce chinnavaṭume pariyādinnavaṭṭe sabbadukkhavītivatte jātitopi anussarati,🔽nāmatopi anussarati, gottatopi anussarati, āyuppamāṇatopi anussarati, sāvakayugatopi
analyzed: chinna papañce chinna vaṭume pariyādinna vaṭṭe sabba dukkha vītivatte jātitaḥ api anussarati  nāmataḥ api anussarati gottataḥ api anussarati āyu ppamāṇataḥ api anussarati sāvaka yugataḥ api
translated: and had laid aside all burdens, destroyed the fetters that bound them to existence, and attained perfect deliverance?

original: anussarati, sāvakasannipātatopi anussarati:
analyzed: anussarati sāvaka sannipātataḥ pi anussarati
translated: He remembers their births, their names, their clans, their conduct, their Dhamma, their wisdom, their freedom, and the number of their disciples.

original: “evaṁjaccā te bhagavanto ahesuṁ itipi, evaṁnāmā evaṅgottā evaṁsīlā evaṁdhammā evaṁpaññā evaṁvihārī evaṁvimuttā te bhagavanto ahesuṁ itipī”’ti?
analyzed: eva jaccā te bhagavantaḥ ahesuṃ iti pi eva nāmā evaṃgottāḥ eva sīlāḥ eva dhammāḥ eva paññāḥ eva vihārī eva vimuttā te bhagavantaḥ ahesuṃ iti pi iti
translated: ‘The Blessed Lord was like this and like that.’

original: Ayaṁ kho no, bhante, antarākathā vippakatā, atha bhagavā anuppatto”ti.
analyzed: ayam kho naḥ bhante antarākathā vippakatā atha bhagavā anuppatto ti
translated: This was the conversation we were having, Lord, when you arrived.”

original: “Tathāgatassevesā, bhikkhave, dhammadhātu suppaṭividdhā, yassā dhammadhātuyā suppaṭividdhattā🔽tathāgato atīte buddhe parinibbute chinnapapañce chinnavaṭume pariyādinnavaṭṭe sabbadukkhavītivatte
analyzed: tathāgatassa iva īsā bhikkhave dhammadhātu su paṭividdhā yassā dhammadhātuyā su paṭividdha ttā  tathāgataḥ atīte buddhe parinibbute chinna papañce chinna vaṭume pariyādinna vaṭṭe sabba dukkha vītivatte
translated: “It’s because the Tathāgata has penetrated the Dhamma-element that he remembers his manifold past lives.🔽He remembers one birth, two, three, four, five, ten, twenty, thirty, forty, fifty,

original: jātitopi anussarati, nāmatopi anussarati, gottatopi anussarati, āyuppamāṇatopi anussarati,
analyzed: jātitaḥ api anussarati nāmataḥ api anussarati gottataḥ api anussarati āyu ppamāṇataḥ api anussarati
translated: a hundred, a thousand, a hundred thousand births;

original: sāvakayugatopi anussarati, sāvakasannipātatopi anussarati:
analyzed: sāvaka yugataḥ api anussarati sāvaka sannipātataḥ api anussarati
translated: he remembers a world-age of world-dissolution, a world-age of world-evolution, a world-age of both dissolution and evolution.

original: ‘evaṁjaccā te bhagavanto ahesuṁ itipi, evaṁnāmā evaṅgottā evaṁsīlā evaṁdhammā evaṁpaññā evaṁvihārī evaṁvimuttā te bhagavanto ahesuṁ itipī’ti.
analyzed: eva jaccā te bhagavantaḥ ahesuṃ iti pi eva nāmā evaṃgottāḥ eva sīlāḥ eva dhammāḥ eva paññāḥ eva vihārī eva vimuttā te bhagavantaḥ ahesuṃ iti pi iti
translated: He remembers: ‘There I was so named, of such a race, with such an appearance, such was my food, such my experience of pleasure and pain, such the end of my life.🔽Passing away from there, I re-arose elsewhere; and there too I was so named, of such a race, with such an appearance, such was my food, such my experience of pleasure and pain, such the end of my life.🔽Passing away from there, I re-arose here.’ Thus he remembers his manifold past lives in their modes and details.

original: Devatāpi tathāgatassa etamatthaṁ ārocesuṁ, yena tathāgato atīte buddhe parinibbute🔽chinnapapañce chinnavaṭume pariyādinnavaṭṭe sabbadukkhavītivatte jātitopi anussarati,
analyzed: devatā api tathāgatassa etam attham ārocesu yena tathāgataḥ atīte buddhe parinibbute 🔽chinna papañce chinna vaṭume pariyādinna vaṭṭe sabba dukkha vītivatte jātitaḥ api anussarati
translated: The deities too told the Tathāgata this, and so he remembers his manifold past lives in their modes and details.

original: nāmatopi anussarati, gottatopi anussarati, āyuppamāṇatopi anussarati, sāvakayugatopi
analyzed: nāmataḥ api anussarati gottataḥ api anussarati āyu ppamāṇataḥ api anussarati sāvaka yugataḥ api
translated: he remembers their names and clans, and he remembers their lives,

original: anussarati, sāvakasannipātatopi anussarati:
analyzed: anussarati sāvaka sannipātataḥ pi anussarati
translated: he remembers their assemblies of disciples,

original: ‘evaṁjaccā te bhagavanto ahesuṁ itipi, evaṁnāmā evaṅgottā evaṁsīlā evaṁdhammā evaṁpaññā evaṁvihārī evaṁvimuttā te bhagavanto ahesuṁ itipī’ti.
analyzed: eva jaccā te bhagavantaḥ ahesuṃ iti pi eva nāmā evaṃgottāḥ eva sīlāḥ eva dhammāḥ eva paññāḥ eva vihārī eva vimuttā te bhagavantaḥ ahesuṃ iti pi iti
translated: he remembers: ‘These Blessed Ones had such and such an origin of the spiritual life, such and such a spiritual birth, such and such a development of the spiritual life, such and such a consummation of the spiritual life.’

original: Iccheyyātha no tumhe, bhikkhave, bhiyyoso mattāya pubbenivāsapaṭisaṁyuttaṁ dhammiṁ kathaṁ sotun”ti?
analyzed: iccheyyātha no tumhe bhikkhave bhiyyosaḥ mattāya pubbenivāsa paṭisayuttam dhammim katham sotuṃ ti
translated: Would you like to hear a further Dhamma talk on past lives?”

original: “Etassa, bhagavā, kālo; etassa, sugata, kālo;
analyzed: etassa bhagavā kālaḥ etassa sugata kālaḥ
translated: “Now is the time, Blessed One! Now is the time, Sublime One!

original: yaṁ bhagavā bhiyyoso mattāya pubbenivāsapaṭisaṁyuttaṁ dhammiṁ kathaṁ kareyya, bhagavato sutvā bhikkhū dhāressantī”ti.
analyzed: yam bhagavā bhiyyosaḥ mattāya pubbenivāsa paṭisayuttam dhammim katham kareyya bhagavato sutvā bhikkhū dhāressanti iti
translated: Now is the time for the Blessed One to give a further Dhamma talk on past lives. Having heard it from the Blessed One, the bhikkhus will remember it.”

original: “Tena hi, bhikkhave, suṇātha, sādhukaṁ manasi karotha, bhāsissāmī”ti.
analyzed: tena hi bhikkhave suṇātha sādhukam manasi karotha bhāsissāmi iti
translated: “Then listen and attend closely to what I shall say.”

original: “Evaṁ, bhante”ti kho te bhikkhū bhagavato paccassosuṁ.
analyzed: eva bhante iti kho te bhikkhū bhagavato
translated: “Yes, venerable sir,” the bhikkhus replied.

original: Bhagavā etadavoca:
analyzed: bhagavān etat avoca
translated: The Blessed One said this:

original: “Ito so, bhikkhave, ekanavutikappe yaṁ vipassī bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho loke udapādi.
analyzed: itas saḥ bhikkhave ekanavuti kappe yam vipassī bhagavā araham sammāsambuddhaḥ loke udapādi
translated: ‘Ekanavutitthe kappे, bhikkhave, vipassī bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho loke udapādi.

original: Vipassī, bhikkhave, bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho khattiyo jātiyā ahosi, khattiyakule udapādi.
analyzed: vipassī bhikkhave bhagavā araham sammāsambuddhaḥ khattiyaḥ jātiyā ahosi khattiya kule udapādi
translated: Vipassī, bhikkhave, bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho khattiyo jātiyā ahosi, khattiyakule udapādi.

original: Vipassī, bhikkhave, bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho koṇḍañño gottena ahosi.
analyzed: vipassī bhikkhave bhagavā araham sammāsambuddhaḥ koṇḍaññaḥ gottena ahosi
translated: Vipassī, bhikkhave, bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho koṇḍañño gottena ahosi.

original: Vipassissa, bhikkhave, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa asītivassasahassāni āyuppamāṇaṁ ahosi.
analyzed: vipassissa bhikkhave bhagavataḥ arahataḥ sammāsambuddhassa asīti vassa sahassāni āyu ppamāṇam ahosi
translated: Vipassissa, bhikkhave, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa asītivassasahassāni āyuppamāṇaṁ ahosi.

original: Vipassī, bhikkhave, bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho pāṭaliyā mūle abhisambuddho.
analyzed: vipassī bhikkhave bhagavā araham sammāsambuddhaḥ pāṭaliyā mūle abhisambuddhaḥ
translated: Vipassī, bhikkhave, bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho pāṭaliyā mūle abhisambuddho.

original: Vipassissa, bhikkhave, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa khaṇḍatissaṁ nāma sāvakayugaṁ ahosi aggaṁ bhaddayugaṁ.
analyzed: vipassissa bhikkhave bhagavataḥ arahataḥ sammāsambuddhassa khaṇḍatissam nāma sāvaka yugam ahosi aggam bhadda yuga
translated: Vipassissa, bhikkhave, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa khaṇḍatissaṁ nāma sāvakayugaṁ ahosi aggaṁ bhaddayugaṁ.

original: Vipassissa, bhikkhave, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa tayo sāvakānaṁ sannipātā ahesuṁ.
analyzed: vipassissa bhikkhave bhagavataḥ arahataḥ sammāsambuddhassa tayo sāvakānam sannipātāḥ ahesu
translated: Vipassissa, bhikkhave, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa tayo sāvakānaṁ sannipātā ahesuṁ.

original: Eko sāvakānaṁ sannipāto ahosi aṭṭhasaṭṭhibhikkhusatasahassaṁ, eko sāvakānaṁ sannipāto ahosi bhikkhusatasahassaṁ, eko sāvakānaṁ sannipāto ahosi asītibhikkhusahassāni.
analyzed: ekaḥ sāvakānam sannipātaḥ ahosi aṭṭhasaṭṭhi bhikkhu sata sahassaḥ ekaḥ sāvakānam sannipātaḥ ahosi bhikkhu sata sahassaḥ ekaḥ sāvakānam sannipātaḥ ahosi asīti bhikkhu sahassāni
translated: The first assembly of disciples consisted of 6,800,000 bhikkhus; the second, of 600,000; the third, of 80,000.

original: Vipassissa, bhikkhave, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa ime tayo sāvakānaṁ sannipātā ahesuṁ sabbesaṁyeva khīṇāsavānaṁ.
analyzed: vipassissa bhikkhave bhagavataḥ arahataḥ sammāsambuddhassa ime tayo sāvakānam sannipātāḥ ahesum khīṇa asavānam
translated: These were the three assemblies of disciples of the Blessed One Vipassi, all of them bhikkhus who had destroyed the taints.

original: Vipassissa, bhikkhave, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa asoko nāma bhikkhu upaṭṭhāko ahosi aggupaṭṭhāko.
analyzed: vipassissa bhikkhave bhagavataḥ arahataḥ sammāsambuddhassa asokaḥ nāma bhikkhu upaṭṭhākaḥ ahosi aggupaṭṭhāko
translated: The Blessed One Vipassi had a supporter named Asoka, a lay follower foremost in giving support.

original: Vipassissa, bhikkhave, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa bandhumā nāma rājā pitā ahosi.
analyzed: vipassissa bhikkhave bhagavataḥ arahataḥ sammāsambuddhassa bandhumā nāma rājā pitā ahosi
translated: The Blessed One Vipassi’s father was King Bandhuma,

original: Bandhumatī nāma devī mātā ahosi janetti.
analyzed: bandhumatī nāma devī mātā
translated: and his mother was Queen Bandhumati.

original: Bandhumassa rañño bandhumatī nāma nagaraṁ rājadhānī ahosi.
analyzed: bandhumassa raññaḥ bandhumatī nāma nagaram rājadhānī ahosi
translated: King Bandhuma’s capital was named Bandhumati.

original: 2. Bodhisattadhammatā
analyzed: bodhisatta dhamma tā
translated: The Nature of the Bodhisatta

original: Atha kho, bhikkhave, vipassī bodhisatto tusitā kāyā cavitvā sato sampajāno mātukucchiṁ okkami.
analyzed: atha kho bhikkhave vipassī bodhisatto tusitā kāyā cavitvā sataḥ sampajānaḥ mātukucchiṃ okkami
translated: Then the Bodhisatta Vipassi, mindful and clearly aware, passed away from the Tusita heaven and entered his mother’s womb.

original: Ayamettha dhammatā.
analyzed: ayam ettha dhamma tā
translated: This is the rule.

original: Dhammatā esā, bhikkhave, yadā bodhisatto tusitā kāyā cavitvā mātukucchiṁ okkamati.
analyzed: dhammatā esā bhikkhave yadā bodhisatto tusitā kāyā cavitvā mātukucchim okkamati
translated: It is the rule that when a Bodhisatta passes away from the Tusita heaven and enters his mother’s womb,

original: Atha sadevake loke samārake sabrahmake sassamaṇabrāhmaṇiyā pajāya sadevamanussāya appamāṇo uḷāro obhāso pātubhavati atikkammeva devānaṁ devānubhāvaṁ.🔽Yāpi tā lokantarikā aghā asaṁvutā andhakārā andhakāratimisā, yatthapime candimasūriyā
analyzed: atha sa devake loke sa mārake sa brahmake sa ssamaṇa brāhmaṇiyā pajāya sa deva manussāya appamāṇaḥ uḷāraḥ obhāsaḥ pātubhavati atikkamma iva devānam deva anubhāva  yā api tā lokantarikāḥ aghāḥ a savutāḥ andhakārāḥ andhakāra timisāḥ candima sūriyā
translated: then in the world with its gods, maras and Brahmas, in this generation with its ascetics and Brahmins, princes and people, an immeasurable, splendid light appears, surpassing the glory of the gods.

original: evaṁmahiddhikā evaṁmahānubhāvā ābhāya nānubhonti, tatthapi appamāṇo uḷāro obhāso🔽pātubhavati atikkammeva devānaṁ devānubhāvaṁ.
analyzed: evam ahiddhikāḥ evam ahā anubhāvāḥ ābhāya na anubhonti tattha api appamāṇaḥ uḷāraḥ obhāsaḥ  pātubhavati atikkamma iva devānam deva anubhāva
translated: And even in those abysmal world-interspaces of total darkness where the light of the sun and moon, so mighty and powerful, sheds no radiance, there too an immeasurable, splendid light appears, surpassing the glory of the gods.

original: Yepi tattha sattā upapannā, tepi tenobhāsena aññamaññaṁ sañjānanti: ‘aññepi kira, bho, santi sattā idhūpapannā’ti.
analyzed: ye pi tattha sattā upapannā te pi tena ubhāsena aññam aññam sañjānanti aññe pi kira bho santi sattāḥ idha upapannā ti
translated: And the beings there, by that light, become aware of one another thus: ‘Other beings have appeared here!’

original: Ayañca dasasahassī lokadhātu saṅkampati sampakampati sampavedhati. Appamāṇo ca uḷāro obhāso loke pātubhavati atikkammeva devānaṁ devānubhāvaṁ.🔽Ayamettha dhammatā.🔽Dhammatā esā, bhikkhave, yadā bodhisatto mātukucchiṁ okkanto hoti, cattāro naṁ devaputtā

translated: For this prince is endowed with the thirty-two marks of a Great Man. When a Great Man is endowed with these marks, there are two possible destinies, and only two.🔽

original: Sace agāraṁ ajjhāvasati, rājā hoti cakkavattī dhammiko dhammarājā cāturanto vijitāvī janapadatthāvariyappatto sattaratanasamannāgato.
analyzed: sace agāram ajjhāvasati rājā hoti cakkavattī dhammikaḥ dhamma rājā cāturantaḥ vijitāvī janapadatthāvariya ppatto satta ratana samannāgato
translated: For this prince is endowed with the thirty-two marks of a Great Man. If he desires the home life, he will become a Wheel-turning Monarch, a righteous king who rules by the Dhamma, master of the four quarters, all-victorious, who has stabilised his country and possesses the seven treasures.

original: Tassimāni sattaratanāni bhavanti.
analyzed: tassa imāni satta ratanāni bhavanti
translated: These are the seven treasures of such a king:

original: Seyyathidaṁ—cakkaratanaṁ hatthiratanaṁ assaratanaṁ maṇiratanaṁ itthiratanaṁ gahapatiratanaṁ pariṇāyakaratanameva sattamaṁ.
analyzed: seyyathida cakka ratanam hatthi ratanam assa ratanam maṇi ratanam itthi ratanam gahapati ratanam pariṇāyaka ratanam eva sattama
translated: the wheel-treasure, the elephant-treasure, the horse-treasure, the jewel-treasure, the woman-treasure, the steward-treasure, and the counsellor-treasure as the seventh.

original: Parosahassaṁ kho panassa puttā bhavanti sūrā vīraṅgarūpā parasenappamaddanā.🔽So imaṁ pathaviṁ sāgarapariyantaṁ adaṇḍena asatthena dhammena abhivijiya ajjhāvasati.
analyzed: parosahassam kho panassa puttāḥ bhavanti sūrāḥ vīraṅga rūpāḥ para sena ppamaddanāḥ  saḥ imam pathavim sāgara pariyantam a daṇḍena a satthena dhammena abhivijiya ajjhāvasati
translated: He will have more than a thousand sons, who will be heroes, of heroic stature, conquerors of the hostile army.🔽He will rule over this land as far as the ocean, without stick or sword, by the Dhamma.

original: Sace kho pana agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajati, arahaṁ hoti sammāsambuddho loke vivaṭacchado.
analyzed: sace kho pana agārasmai anagāriyam pabbajati araham hoti sammāsambuddhaḥ loke vivaṭa chadaḥ
translated: But if he goes forth from the home life into homelessness, then he will become an Accomplished One, a Fully Enlightened One, who draws aside the veil in the world.

original: Katamehi cāyaṁ, deva, kumāro dvattiṁsamahāpurisalakkhaṇehi samannāgato, yehi samannāgatassa mahāpurisassa dveva gatiyo bhavanti anaññā.
analyzed: katamehi ca aya deva kumāraḥ dvattisa mahāpurisa lakkhaṇehi samannāgataḥ yehi samannāgatassa mahāpurisassa dve iva gatiyaḥ bhavanti anaññā
translated: “What are the thirty-two marks?

original: Sace agāraṁ ajjhāvasati, rājā hoti cakkavattī dhammiko dhammarājā cāturanto vijitāvī janapadatthāvariyappatto sattaratanasamannāgato.
analyzed: sace agāram ajjhāvasati rājā hoti cakkavattī dhammikaḥ dhamma rājā cāturantaḥ vijitāvī janapadatthāvariya ppatto satta ratana samannāgato
translated: If he lives the home life, he becomes a wheel-turning monarch, a righteous king who rules by the Dhamma, master of the four quarters, all-victorious, who has stabilised his country and possesses the seven treasures.

original: Tassimāni sattaratanāni bhavanti.
analyzed: tassa imāni satta ratanāni bhavanti
translated: These are the seven treasures he possesses:

original: Seyyathidaṁ—cakkaratanaṁ hatthiratanaṁ assaratanaṁ maṇiratanaṁ itthiratanaṁ gahapatiratanaṁ pariṇāyakaratanameva sattamaṁ.
analyzed: seyyathida cakka ratanam hatthi ratanam assa ratanam maṇi ratanam itthi ratanam gahapati ratanam pariṇāyaka ratanam eva sattama
translated: the wheel-treasure, the elephant-treasure, the horse-treasure, the jewel-treasure, the woman-treasure, the steward-treasure, and the counsellor-treasure as the seventh.

original: Parosahassaṁ kho panassa puttā bhavanti sūrā vīraṅgarūpā parasenappamaddanā.🔽So imaṁ pathaviṁ sāgarapariyantaṁ adaṇḍena asatthena dhammena abhivijiya ajjhāvasati.
analyzed: parosahassam kho panassa puttāḥ bhavanti sūrāḥ vīraṅga rūpāḥ para sena ppamaddanāḥ  saḥ imam pathavim sāgara pariyantam a daṇḍena a satthena dhammena abhivijiya ajjhāvasati
translated: He has more than a thousand sons, who are heroes, of heroic stature, conquerors of the hostile army.🔽Having conquered this earth, bounded by the ocean, he dwells, having overcome (opposition) by Dhamma.

original: Sace kho pana agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajati, arahaṁ hoti sammāsambuddho loke vivaṭacchado.
analyzed: sace kho pana agārasmai anagāriyam pabbajati araham hoti sammāsambuddhaḥ loke vivaṭa chadaḥ
translated: But if he goes forth from the home to the homeless life, he becomes an Accomplished One, a Fully Enlightened One, who draws back the veil from the world.

original: Ayañhi, deva, kumāro suppatiṭṭhitapādo. Yaṁ pāyaṁ, deva, kumāro suppatiṭṭhitapādo.
analyzed: ayam hi deva kumāro su patiṭṭhita pādaḥ yam deva kumāro su patiṭṭhita pādaḥ
translated: He has level-set feet.

original: Idampissa mahāpurisassa mahāpurisalakkhaṇaṁ bhavati.
analyzed: idam pi issa mahā purisassa mahā purisa lakkhaṇam bhavati
translated: This is a mark of a Great Man.

original: Imassa, deva, kumārassa heṭṭhā pādatalesu cakkāni jātāni sahassārāni sanemikāni sanābhikāni🔽sabbākāraparipūrāni. Yampi imassa, deva, kumārassa heṭṭhā pādatalesu cakkāni jātāni
analyzed: imassa deva kumārassa heṭṭhā pāda talesu cakkāni jātāni sahassārāni sa nemikāni sa nābhikāni  sabba ākāra paripūrāni yat pi imassa deva kumārassa heṭṭhā pāda talesu cakkāni jātāni
translated: He has wheels on the soles of his feet, with a thousand spokes.

original: sahassārāni sanemikāni sanābhikāni sabbākāraparipūrāni, idampissa mahāpurisassa mahāpurisalakkhaṇaṁ bhavati.
analyzed: sahassārāni sa nemikāni sa nābhikāni sabba ākāra paripūrāni idam pi issa mahā purisassa mahā purisa lakkhaṇam bhavati
translated: This is a mark of a Great Man.

original: Ayañhi, deva, kumāro āyatapaṇhī …pe…
analyzed: ayan hi deva kumāraḥ āyata paṇhī pe
translated: He has projecting heels.

original: Ayañhi, deva, kumāro dīghaṅgulī …pe…🔽Ayañhi, deva, kumāro mudutalunahatthapādo …pe…🔽Ayañhi, deva kumāro jālahatthapādo …pe…
analyzed: ayan hi deva kumāraḥ  ayam hi deva kumāraḥ  ayam hi deva kumāraḥ jālahattha pādaḥ
translated: He has long fingers and toes.🔽He has soft and tender hands and feet.

original: Ayañhi, deva, kumāro ussaṅkhapādo …pe…
analyzed: ayam hi deva kumāraḥ ussaṅkhapādaḥ pe
translated: He has net-like hands and feet.🔽He has high-set ankles.

original: Ayañhi, deva, kumāro eṇijaṅgho …pe…
analyzed: ayan hi deva kumāraḥ eṇijaṅghaḥ
translated: He has legs like an antelope’s.

original: Ayañhi, deva, kumāro ṭhitakova anonamanto ubhohi pāṇitalehi jaṇṇukāni parimasati parimajjati …pe…
analyzed: ayan hi deva kumāraḥ ṭhitakaḥ uva anonamantaḥ ubhohi pāṇi talehi jaṇṇukāni parimasati parimajjati pe
translated: He can touch his kneecaps with his hands when standing without bending and without raising his arms.

original: Ayañhi, deva, kumāro kosohitavatthaguyho …pe…
analyzed: ayan hi deva kumāro kosohitavatthaguyho pe
translated: He has a sexual organ that is concealed in a sheath.

original: Ayañhi, deva, kumāro suvaṇṇavaṇṇo kañcanasannibhattaco …pe…
analyzed: ayan hi deva kumāraḥ suvaṇṇa vaṇṇaḥ kañcana sannibhattacaḥ pe
translated: He has skin that is golden colored and has a golden sheen.

original: Ayañhi, deva, kumāro sukhumacchavī; sukhumattā chaviyā rajojallaṁ kāye na upalimpati …pe…🔽Ayañhi, deva, kumāro ekekalomo; ekekāni lomāni lomakūpesu jātāni …pe…
analyzed: ayam hi deva kumāraḥ sukhuma chavī sukhuma tā chaviyā rajaḥ jallam kāye na upalimpati pe  ayan hi deva kumāraḥ ekeka lomaḥ ekekāni lomāni lomakūpesu jātāni
translated: He has skin that is so smooth that dust and dirt do not stick to his body.🔽He has one hair per pore.

original: Ayañhi, deva, kumāro uddhaggalomo; uddhaggāni lomāni jātāni nīlāni añjanavaṇṇāni kuṇḍalāvaṭṭāni dakkhiṇāvaṭṭakajātāni …pe…
analyzed: ayam hi deva kumāraḥ uddhagga lomaḥ uddhaggāni lomāni jātāni nīlāni añjana vaṇṇāni kuṇḍala avaṭṭāni dakkhiṇā vaṭṭaka jātāni pe
translated: The hairs on his body grow singly and are soft, dark blue, and curl to the right.

original: Ayañhi, deva, kumāro brahmujugatto …pe…🔽Ayañhi, deva, kumāro sattussado …pe…🔽Ayañhi, deva, kumāro sīhapubbaddhakāyo …pe…
analyzed: ayan hi deva kumāraḥ  ayan hi deva kumāraḥ sattussadaḥ pe  ayam hi deva kumāraḥ sīha pubbaddha kāyaḥ pe
translated: He has the body of a noble one.🔽He has seven convex surfaces.🔽He has the shoulders of a lion.

original: Ayañhi, deva, kumāro citantaraṁso …pe…
analyzed: ayan hi deva kumāraḥ citantarasaḥ pe
translated: He has a chest between the shoulders that is well-rounded.

original: Ayañhi, deva, kumāro nigrodhaparimaṇḍalo yāvatakvassa kāyo tāvatakvassa byāmo, yāvatakvassa byāmo, tāvatakvassa kāyo …pe…
analyzed: ayam hi deva kumāraḥ nigrodha parimaṇḍalaḥ yāvatakvassa kāyo tāvatakvassa byāmaḥ yāvatakvassa byāmaḥ tāvatakvassa kāyaḥ pe
translated: His body is straight, like a banyan tree.

original: Ayañhi, deva, kumāro samavaṭṭakkhandho …pe…🔽Ayañhi, deva, kumāro rasaggasaggī …pe…
analyzed: ayam hi deva kumāraḥ samavaṭṭa khandhaḥ pe  ayam hi deva kumāraḥ rasagga saggī pe
translated: His shoulders are well-rounded.🔽He has a very good sense of taste.

original: Ayañhi, deva, kumāro sīhahanu …pe…
analyzed: ayan hi deva kumāraḥ
translated: He has a lion’s jaw.

original: Ayañhi, deva, kumāro cattālīsadanto …pe…🔽Ayañhi, deva, kumāro samadanto …pe…🔽Ayañhi, deva, kumāro aviraḷadanto …pe…
analyzed: ayam hi deva kumāro cattālīsa danto pe  ayan hi deva kumāraḥ samadantaḥ pe  ayan hi deva kumāraḥ a viraḍa dantaḥ
translated: He has forty teeth.🔽His teeth are even.🔽His teeth are without gaps.

original: Ayañhi, deva, kumāro susukkadāṭho …pe…🔽Ayañhi, deva, kumāro pahūtajivho …pe…
analyzed: ayam hi deva kumāraḥ su sukka dāṭhaḥ pe  ayan hi deva kumāraḥ pahūta jivhaḥ
translated: His teeth are very white.🔽He has a large tongue.

original: Ayañhi, deva, kumāro brahmassaro karavīkabhāṇī …pe…
analyzed: ayam hi deva kumāraḥ brahmassaraḥ karavīka bhāṇī
translated: He has a voice like Brahma’s.

original: Ayañhi, deva, kumāro abhinīlanetto …pe…
analyzed: ayam hi deva kumāraḥ abhinīla nettaḥ
translated: His eyes are deep blue.

original: Ayañhi, deva, kumāro gopakhumo …pe…
analyzed: ayan hi deva kumāraḥ gopa khumaḥ pe
translated: He has eyelashes like a cow’s.

original: Imassa, deva, kumārassa uṇṇā bhamukantare jātā odātā mudutūlasannibhā. Yampi imassa,
analyzed: imassa deva kumārassa uṇṇā bhamuka antare jātā odātā mudu tūla sannibhā yampi imassa
translated: He has hair growing in the space between his eyebrows,

original: deva, kumārassa uṇṇā bhamukantare jātā odātā mudutūlasannibhā, idampimassa mahāpurisassa🔽mahāpurisalakkhaṇaṁ bhavati.
analyzed: deva kumārassa uṇṇā odātā mudu tūla sannibhā idampimassa mahā purisassa  mahāpurisa lakkhaṇam bhavati
translated: ‘Sire, on the top of his head there grows up a fleshy knob, white like a jasmine-bunch, soft and yielding, a most delightful thing to touch. This is a mark of the Great Man.🔽‘Sire, this prince has hair growing in the cleft of his skull. This is a mark of the Great Man.🔽‘Sire, this prince has eyelashes like a cow’s. This is a mark of the Great Man.🔽‘Sire, this prince has a body the shape of which is most perfect. This is a mark of the Great Man.

analyzed: ayam hi deva kumāraḥ uṇhīsa sīsaḥ yam deva kumāraḥ uṇhīsa sīsaḥ idam pissa mahā purisassa mahā purisa lakkhaṇam bhavati  imehi kho deva kumāraḥ dvattisa mahāpurisa lakkhaṇehi samannāgataḥ yehi samannāgatassa mahāpurisassa dvā iva gatiyaḥ bhavanti anaññā

This is a mark of the Great Man.🔽‘Sire, this prince has a body that is well-proportioned. This is a mark of the Great Man.🔽‘Sire, this prince has a body that is well-rounded. This is a mark of the Great Man.🔽‘Sire, this prince has a body that is well-developed. This is a mark of the Great Man.

translated: ‘Sire, this prince has a body that is pure and clean. This is a mark of the Great Man.

analyzed: tassa imāni satta ratanāni bhavanti

This is a mark of the Great Man.🔽‘Sire, this prince has a body that is well-shaped like a nyagrodha tree. This is a mark of the Great Man.🔽‘Sire, this prince has a body that is well-rounded like a nyagrodha tree. This is a mark of the Great Man.🔽‘Sire, this prince has a body that is well-developed like a nyagrodha tree. This is a mark of the Great Man.

analyzed: seyyathida cakka ratanam hatthi ratanam assa ratanam maṇi ratanam itthi ratanam gahapati ratanam pariṇāyaka ratanam eva sattama
translated: namely, the elephant treasure, the horse treasure, the jewel treasure, the woman treasure, the steward treasure, and the counselor treasure as the seventh.
