original: ‘Sele yathā pabbatamuddhaniṭṭhito,
analyzed: sele yathā pabbata muddha niṭṭhito
translated: ‘As one who stands on a mountain peak beholds

original: Yathāpi passe janataṁ samantato;🔽Tathūpamaṁ dhammamayaṁ sumedha,🔽Pāsādamāruyha samantacakkhu;🔽Sokāvatiṇṇaṁ janatamapetasoko,
analyzed: yathā api passe janatam samantataḥ  tathūpamam dhamma mayam sumedha  pāsādam āruyha samanta cakkhu  soka avatiṇṇam janatam apeta sokaḥ
translated: The people all around him,🔽So, O Wise One, from your Dhamma-palace,🔽All-seeing One, behold the people,

original: Avekkhassu jātijarābhibhūtaṁ.
analyzed: avekkhassu jāti jarā abhibhūta
translated: Who are overcome by birth and decay.

original: Uṭṭhehi vīra vijitasaṅgāma,
analyzed: uṭṭhehi vīra vijita saṅgāma
translated: Arise, O Hero, Conqueror in the Battle!

original: Satthavāha aṇaṇa vicara loke;
analyzed: satthavāha aṇaṇa vicara loke
translated: Leader, go forth, O Blameless One, and travel through the world!

original: Desassu bhagavā dhammaṁ,
analyzed: desassu bhagavā dhamma
translated: Let the Lord teach the Dhamma,

original: Aññātāro bhavissantī’ti.
analyzed: aññātāraḥ bhavissanti iti
translated: There will be those who will understand!’

original: Atha kho, bhikkhave, vipassī bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho taṁ mahābrahmānaṁ gāthāya ajjhabhāsi:
analyzed: atha kho bhikkhave vipassī bhagavā araham sammāsambuddhaḥ tam mahābrahmānam gāthāya ajjhabhāsi
translated: Then the Lord Buddha Vipassi replied to the Great Brahma in these verses:

original: ‘Apārutā tesaṁ amatassa dvārā,
analyzed: apārutā tesam amatassa dvārā
translated: ‘The doors to the Deathless are thrown open;

original: Ye sotavanto pamuñcantu saddhaṁ;
analyzed: ye sotavantaḥ pamuñcantu saddha
translated: Let those who have ears go to the refuge!

original: Vihiṁsasaññī paguṇaṁ na bhāsiṁ,
analyzed: vihisa saññī paguṇam na bhāsi
translated: I will not speak of what I have not seen,

original: Dhammaṁ paṇītaṁ manujesu brahme’ti.
analyzed: dhammam paṇītam manujesu brahmā iti
translated: The Dhamma is sublime, O Brahmā, among men.’

original: Atha kho so, bhikkhave, mahābrahmā: ‘katāvakāso khomhi vipassinā bhagavatā arahatā🔽sammāsambuddhena dhammadesanāyā’ti vipassiṁ bhagavantaṁ arahantaṁ sammāsambuddhaṁ
analyzed: atha kho saḥ bhikkhave mahābrahmā kata avakāsaḥ kho mhi vipassinā bhagavatā arahatā  sammāsambuddhena dhamma desanāya ati vipassim bhagavantam arahantam sammāsambuddha
translated: Then that Great Brahmā, thinking: ‘I have gained my opportunity to request the Fortunate One, the Worthy One, the Perfect Sambuddha

original: abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṁ katvā tattheva antaradhāyi.
analyzed: abhivādetvā padakkhiṇam katvā tattha iva antaradhāyi
translated: to teach the Dhamma,’ after worshipping and circumambulating the Fortunate One, he vanished right there.

original: 13. Aggasāvakayuga
analyzed: agga sāvaka yuga
translated: . The Foremost Pair of Disciples

original: Atha kho, bhikkhave, vipassissa bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa etadahosi:
analyzed: atha kho bhikkhave vipassissa bhagavataḥ arahataḥ sammāsambuddhassa etat ahosi
translated: Then, monks, this occurred to the Fortunate One, the Perfect Sambuddha Vipassī:

original: ‘kassa nu kho ahaṁ paṭhamaṁ dhammaṁ deseyyaṁ,
analyzed: kassa nu kho aham paṭhamam dhammam deseyya
translated: ‘To whom should I first teach the Dhamma?

original: ko imaṁ dhammaṁ khippameva ājānissatī’ti?
analyzed: kaḥ imam dhammam khippam eva ājānissati iti
translated: Who will be able to understand the Dhamma quickly?’

original: Atha kho, bhikkhave, vipassissa bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa etadahosi:
analyzed: atha kho bhikkhave vipassissa bhagavataḥ arahataḥ sammāsambuddhassa etat ahosi
translated: Then, monks, this occurred to the Fortunate One, the Perfect Sambuddha Vipassī:

original: ‘ayaṁ kho khaṇḍo ca rājaputto tisso ca purohitaputto bandhumatiyā rājadhāniyā paṭivasanti paṇḍitā viyattā medhāvino dīgharattaṁ apparajakkhajātikā.
analyzed: ayam kho khaṇḍaḥ ca rāja putto tisso ca purohita putto bandhumatiyā rājadhāniyā paṭivasanti paṇḍitāḥ viyattāḥ medhāvinaḥ dīgharattam appara jakkha jātikā
translated: ‘These two young men, Khaṇḍa the young brāhmaṇa and Tissa the young brāhmaṇa, are wise, learned, clever, and have been my companions and friends for a long time.

original: Yannūnāhaṁ khaṇḍassa ca rājaputtassa, tissassa ca purohitaputtassa paṭhamaṁ dhammaṁ deseyyaṁ, te imaṁ dhammaṁ khippameva ājānissantī’ti.🔽Atha kho, bhikkhave, vipassī bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho seyyathāpi nāma balavā🔽puriso samiñjitaṁ vā bāhaṁ pasāreyya, pasāritaṁ vā bāhaṁ samiñjeyya; evameva—bodhirukkhamūle
analyzed: yat nūna aham khaṇḍassa ca rāja puttassa tissassa ca purohita puttassa paṭhamam dhammam deseyya te imam dhammam khippam eva ājānissanti iti  atha kho bhikkhave vipassī bhagavā araham sammāsambuddhaḥ seyyathā api nāma balavā  purisaḥ samiñjitam vā bāham pasāreyya pasāritam vā bāham samiñjeyya evam eva bodhi rukkha mūle
translated: I will teach the Dhamma first to Prince Khanda and to Prince Tissa, the son of the chief priest. They will quickly understand this Dhamma.’

original: antarahito bandhumatiyā rājadhāniyā kheme migadāye pāturahosi.
analyzed: antarahitaḥ bandhumatiyā rājadhāniyā kheme migadāye
translated: Then, just as a strong man might extend his flexed arm or flex his extended arm, the Lord Buddha Vipassi disappeared from the foot of the Goatherd’s Banyan and reappeared in the Deer Park in the Sambaradana.

original: Atha kho, bhikkhave, vipassī bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho dāyapālaṁ āmantesi:
analyzed: atha kho bhikkhave vipassī bhagavā araham sammāsambuddhaḥ dāyapālam āmantesi
translated: And the Lord Buddha Vipassi addressed the park-keeper, saying:

original: ‘ehi tvaṁ, samma dāyapāla, bandhumatiṁ rājadhāniṁ pavisitvā khaṇḍañca rājaputtaṁ tissañca purohitaputtaṁ evaṁ vadehi—
analyzed: ehi tva samma dāyapāla bandhumatim rājadhānim pavisitvā khaṇḍam ca rāja puttam tissam ca purohita puttam evam vadehi
translated: ‘Go, my good park-keeper, to Bandhumati and tell Prince Khanda and Prince Tissa, the son of the chief priest, that the Teacher calls them.’

original: vipassī, bhante, bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho bandhumatiṁ rājadhāniṁ anuppatto kheme migadāye viharati, so tumhākaṁ dassanakāmo’ti.
analyzed: vipassī bhante bhagavā araham sammāsambuddhaḥ bandhumatim rājadhānim anuppattaḥ kheme migadāye viharati saḥ tumhākam dassana kāmo ti
translated: ‘Lord, the Lord Buddha Vipassī has arrived at Bandhumati and is staying in the Khema deer-park. He wishes to see you.’

original: ‘Evaṁ, bhante’ti kho, bhikkhave, dāyapālo vipassissa bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa
analyzed: eva bhante iti kho bhikkhave dāyapālaḥ vipassissa bhagavataḥ arahataḥ sammāsambuddhassa
translated: ‘Yes, Lord’, replied the park-keeper, and he went to Bandhumati,

original: paṭissutvā bandhumatiṁ rājadhāniṁ pavisitvā khaṇḍañca rājaputtaṁ tissañca purohitaputtaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: paṭissutvā bandhumatim rājadhānim pavisitvā khaṇḍam ca rāja puttam tissam ca purohita puttam etat avoca
translated: and he told Prince Khanda and Prince Tissa:

original: ‘vipassī, bhante, bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho bandhumatiṁ rājadhāniṁ anuppatto kheme migadāye viharati; so tumhākaṁ dassanakāmo’ti.
analyzed: vipassī bhante bhagavā araham sammāsambuddhaḥ bandhumatim rājadhānim anuppattaḥ kheme migadāye viharati saḥ tumhākam dassana kāmo ti
translated: ‘Lord, the Lord Buddha Vipassī has arrived at Bandhumati and is staying in the Khema deer-park. He wishes to see you.’

original: Atha kho, bhikkhave, khaṇḍo ca rājaputto tisso ca purohitaputto bhaddāni bhaddāni
analyzed: atha kho bhikkhave khaṇḍaḥ ca rāja putto tisso ca purohita putto bhaddāni bhaddāni
translated: Then Prince Khanda and Prince Tissa had the finest carriages made ready,

original: yānāni yojāpetvā bhaddaṁ bhaddaṁ yānaṁ abhiruhitvā bhaddehi bhaddehi yānehi bandhumatiyā
analyzed: yānāni yojāpetvā bhaddam bhaddam yānam abhiruhitvā bhaddehi bhaddehi yānehi bandhumatiyā
translated: and mounting them, they drove out of Bandhumati

original: rājadhāniyā niyyiṁsu. Yena khemo migadāyo tena pāyiṁsu.
analyzed: rājadhāniyā yena khemaḥ migadāyo tena
translated: and went to the Khema deer-park.

original: Yāvatikā yānassa bhūmi, yānena gantvā yānā paccorohitvā pattikāva yena vipassī bhagavā
analyzed: yāvatikā yānassa bhūmi yānena gantvā yānā paccorohitvā yena vipassī bhagavā
translated: They went by vehicle as far as the ground was suitable for a vehicle, and then they continued on foot to where the Buddha Vipassī was.

original: arahaṁ sammāsambuddho tenupasaṅkamiṁsu. upasaṅkamitvā vipassiṁ bhagavantaṁ arahantaṁ🔽sammāsambuddhaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdiṁsu.
analyzed: araham sammāsambuddhaḥ tena upasaṅkamisu upasaṅkamitvā vipassim bhagavantam arahanta  sammāsambuddham abhivādetvā ekamantam
translated: They then bowed down to the Buddha Vipassī and sat down to one side.

original: Tesaṁ vipassī bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho anupubbiṁ kathaṁ kathesi, seyyathidaṁ—
analyzed: tesam vipassī bhagavā araham sammāsambuddhaḥ anupubbim katham kathesi
translated: The Buddha Vipassī gave them a progressive talk—

original: dānakathaṁ sīlakathaṁ saggakathaṁ kāmānaṁ ādīnavaṁ okāraṁ saṅkilesaṁ nekkhamme ānisaṁsaṁ pakāsesi.
analyzed: dāna katham sīla katham sagga katham kāmānam ādīnavam okāram saṅkilesam nekkhamme ānisasam pakāsesi
translated: that is, talk on generosity, talk on morality, talk on heaven, and he explained the danger, degradation, and defilement in worldly pleasures, and the benefit of renunciation.

original: Yadā te bhagavā aññāsi kallacitte muducitte vinīvaraṇacitte udaggacitte pasannacitte, atha yā buddhānaṁ sāmukkaṁsikā dhammadesanā, taṁ pakāsesi—
analyzed: yadā te bhagavā aññāsi kalla citte mudu citte vinīvaraṇa citte udagga citte pasanna citte atha yā buddhānam sāmukkasikā dhamma desanā tam pakāsesi
translated: When the Buddha Vipassī knew that their minds were ready, supple, without hindrances, joyful, and confident, he revealed the teaching unique to the Buddhas:

original: dukkhaṁ samudayaṁ nirodhaṁ maggaṁ.
analyzed: dukkham samudayam nirodham magga
translated: suffering, its origin, its end, and the path.

original: Seyyathāpi nāma suddhaṁ vatthaṁ apagatakāḷakaṁ sammadeva rajanaṁ paṭiggaṇheyya;
analyzed: seyyathā api nāma suddham vattham apagata kāḷakam sammat eva rajanam paṭiggaṇheyya
translated: Just as a clean and stainless cloth absorbs dye properly,

original: evameva khaṇḍassa ca rājaputtassa tissassa ca purohitaputtassa tasmiṁyeva āsane virajaṁ vītamalaṁ dhammacakkhuṁ udapādi:
analyzed: evam eva khaṇḍassa ca rāja puttassa tissassa ca purohita puttassa tasmiyā eva āsane virajam vīta malam dhamma cakkhum udapādi
translated: In the same way, while sitting right there, Khaṇḍa and Tissa experienced the stainless vision of the Truth:

original: ‘yaṁ kiñci samudayadhammaṁ sabbaṁ taṁ nirodhadhamman’ti.🔽Te diṭṭhadhammā pattadhammā viditadhammā pariyogāḷhadhammā tiṇṇavicikicchā vigatakathaṅkathā
analyzed: yam kiñci samudaya dhammam sabbam tat nirodha dhamman ti  te diṭṭha dhammā patta dhammā vidita dhammā pariyogāḷha dhammā tiṇṇa vicikicchāḥ vigata kathaṅkathāḥ
translated: ‘Anything that has a beginning has an end.’

original: vesārajjappattā aparappaccayā satthusāsane vipassiṁ bhagavantaṁ arahantaṁ sammāsambuddhaṁ etadavocuṁ:
analyzed: vesārajja ppattāḥ apara paccayā satthu sāsane vipassim bhagavantam arahantam sammāsambuddham etat avocuḥ
translated: They had seen the Truth, had reached, understood, and penetrated it. They had gone beyond doubt and uncertainty, had attained to confidence, and had become independent of others in the Teacher’s instruction. They then said to the Buddha Vipassī,

original: ‘abhikkantaṁ, bhante, abhikkantaṁ, bhante.
analyzed: abhikkanta bhante abhikkanta bhante
translated: ‘Wonderful, Lord, wonderful!

original: Seyyathāpi, bhante, nikkujjitaṁ vā ukkujjeyya, paṭicchannaṁ vā vivareyya, mūḷhassa
analyzed: sā iyyathā api bhante nikkujjitam vā ukkujjeyya paṭicchannam vā vivareyya mūḷhassa
translated: Just as one might set upright what has been overturned,

original: vā maggaṁ ācikkheyya, andhakāre vā telapajjotaṁ dhāreyya: “cakkhumanto rūpāni dakkhantī”ti;
analyzed: vā maggam ācikkheyya andhakāre vā tela pajjotam dhāreyya cakkhumantaḥ rūpāni dakkhanti iti
translated: or reveal what has been hidden, or show the way to one who is lost, or bring a lamp into the darkness so that one with eyes might see what is there—

original: evamevaṁ bhagavatā anekapariyāyena dhammo pakāsito.
analyzed: evam evam bhagavatā aneka pariyāyena dhammo pakāsito
translated: just so has the Buddha made the Teaching clear in many ways.

original: Ete mayaṁ, bhante, bhagavantaṁ saraṇaṁ gacchāma dhammañca.
analyzed: ete bhante bhagavantam saraṇam gacchāma dhammam ca
translated: We go for refuge to the Blessed One and to the Dhamma.

original: Labheyyāma mayaṁ, bhante, bhagavato santike pabbajjaṁ, labheyyāma upasampadan’ti.
analyzed: labheyyāma bhante bhagavato santike pabbajja labheyyāma upasampadanti
translated: May we receive the going forth in the Blessed One’s presence; may we receive the full admission.”

original: Alatthuṁ kho, bhikkhave, khaṇḍo ca rājaputto, tisso ca purohitaputto vipassissa bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa santike pabbajjaṁ alatthuṁ upasampadaṁ.
analyzed: a latthum kho bhikkhave khaṇḍaḥ ca rāja putto tisso ca purohita putto vipassissa bhagavataḥ arahataḥ sammāsambuddhassa santike pabbajjam a latthum upasampadaḥ
translated: “Khanda and Tissa received the going forth in the Blessed One’s presence, and they received the full admission.

original: Te vipassī bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho dhammiyā kathāya sandassesi samādapesi samuttejesi sampahaṁsesi;🔽saṅkhārānaṁ ādīnavaṁ okāraṁ saṅkilesaṁ nibbāne ānisaṁsaṁ pakāsesi.🔽Tesaṁ vipassinā bhagavatā arahatā sammāsambuddhena dhammiyā kathāya sandassiyamānānaṁ🔽samādapiyamānānaṁ samuttejiyamānānaṁ sampahaṁsiyamānānaṁ nacirasseva anupādāya āsavehi cittāni vimucciṁsu.
analyzed: te vipassī bhagavā araham sammāsambuddhaḥ dhammiyā kathāya sandassesi samādapesi samuttejesi sampahasesi  saṅkhārānam ādīnavam okāram saṅkilesam nibbāne ānisasam pakāsesi  tesam vipassinā bhagavatā arahatā sammāsambuddhena dhammiyā kathāya sandassiyamānāna  samādapiyamānānam samuttejiyamānānam sampahasiyamānānam nacirassa iva an upādāya āsavehi cittāni
translated: The Blessed One instructed, urged, roused, & encouraged them with a Dhamma talk.🔽He revealed the Dhamma that is good in the beginning, good in the middle, and good in the end, with its own meaning, with its own phrasing—the holy life, complete & pure.

original: 14. Mahājanakāyapabbajjā
analyzed: mahā jana kāya pabbajjā
translated: Having heard the Dhamma, Khanda & Tissa dwelled striving, struggling, burning, & sweating for the realization of the fruit of stream entry.🔽Before long, dwelling striving, struggling, burning, & sweating for the realization of the fruit of stream entry, they realized the fruit of stream entry.

original: Assosi kho, bhikkhave, bandhumatiyā rājadhāniyā mahājanakāyo caturāsītipāṇasahassāni:
analyzed: assosi kho bhikkhave bandhumatiyāḥ rājadhāniyāḥ mahā jana kāyaḥ catur asīti pāṇa sahassāni
translated: And a great crowd of people from Bandhumati heard that

original: ‘vipassī kira bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho bandhumatiṁ rājadhāniṁ anuppatto kheme migadāye viharati.
analyzed: vipassī kira bhagavā araham sammāsambuddhaḥ bandhumatim rājadhānim an uppattaḥ kheme migadāye viharati
translated: the Buddha Vipassi had arrived and was staying in the deer-park at Khema,

original: Khaṇḍo ca kira rājaputto tisso ca purohitaputto vipassissa bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa
analyzed: khaṇḍo ca kira rāja putto tisso ca purohita putto vipassissa bhagavataḥ arahataḥ sammāsambuddhassa
translated: and that Prince Khanda and Prince Tissa had gone forth into homelessness in the presence of the Lord Buddha Vipassi,🔽shaving off their hair and beards, clothing themselves in the yellow robe,

original: santike kesamassuṁ ohāretvā kāsāyāni vatthāni acchādetvā agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajitā’ti.
analyzed: santike kesa massum ohāretvā kāsāyāni vatthāni acchādetvā agārasma anagāriyam pabbajitā ati
translated: and going forth from the home life into homelessness.

original: Sutvāna nesaṁ etadahosi:
analyzed: sutvāna etad ahosi
translated: And they said:

original: ‘na hi nūna so orako dhammavinayo, na sā orakā pabbajjā, yattha khaṇḍo ca rājaputto🔽tisso ca purohitaputto kesamassuṁ ohāretvā kāsāyāni vatthāni acchādetvā agārasmā
analyzed: na hi nūna saḥ orakaḥ dhamma vinayaḥ na sā orakā pabbajjā yattha khaṇḍaḥ ca rāja putto  tissaḥ ca purohita putto kesa massuṃ ohāretvā kāsāyāni vatthāni acchādetvā agārasmā
translated: ‘It must be a very special Dhamma and Discipline, a very special going-forth, a very special life of holiness,

original: anagāriyaṁ pabbajitā.
analyzed: anagāriyam pabbajitā
translated: since Prince Khanda and Prince Tissa have shaved off their hair and beards, put on the yellow robe, and gone forth from the home life into homelessness.

original: Khaṇḍo ca rājaputto tisso ca purohitaputto kesamassuṁ ohāretvā kāsāyāni vatthāni acchādetvā agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajissanti, kimaṅgaṁ pana mayan’ti.
analyzed: khaṇḍaḥ ca rāja putto tisso ca purohita putto kesa massuṃ ohāretvā kāsāyāni vatthāni acchādetvā agārasma anagāriyam pabbajissanti kimaṅgam pana mayanti
translated: ‘If Prince Khanda and Prince Tissa, the king’s two chief ministers, shave off their hair and beard, put on the yellow robe, and go forth into homelessness, why shouldn’t we do the same?’

original: Atha kho so, bhikkhave, mahājanakāyo caturāsītipāṇasahassāni bandhumatiyā rājadhāniyā
analyzed: atha kho saḥ bhikkhave mahā jana kāyaḥ catur āsīti pāṇa sahassāni bandhumatiyāḥ rājadhāniyāḥ
translated: Then that great crowd of eighty-four thousand people left the city of Bandhumati🔽and went to the Khema deer-park where the Blessed One Vipassi was.

original: nikkhamitvā yena khemo migadāyo yena vipassī bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho tenupasaṅkamiṁsu;🔽upasaṅkamitvā vipassiṁ bhagavantaṁ arahantaṁ sammāsambuddhaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdiṁsu.
analyzed: nikkhamitvā yena khemaḥ migadāyaḥ yena vipassī bhagavā araham sammāsambuddho tena upasaṅkamisu  upasaṅkamitvā vipassim bhagavantam arahantam sammāsambuddham abhivādetvā ekamantam nisīdisu
translated: They bowed down to the Blessed One and sat to one side.

original: Tesaṁ vipassī bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho anupubbiṁ kathaṁ kathesi.
analyzed: tesam vipassī bhagavā araham sammāsambuddhaḥ anupubbim katham kathesi
translated: The Blessed One gave them a graduated talk:

original: Seyyathidaṁ—dānakathaṁ sīlakathaṁ saggakathaṁ kāmānaṁ ādīnavaṁ okāraṁ saṅkilesaṁ nekkhamme ānisaṁsaṁ pakāsesi.
analyzed: sīla katham sagga katham kāmānam ādīnavam okāram saṅkilesam nekkhamme ānisasam pakāsesi
translated: that is, talk on giving, talk on virtue, talk on heaven, and he explained the danger, degradation, and defilement in worldly pleasures, and the benefit of renunciation.

original: Yadā te bhagavā aññāsi kallacitte muducitte vinīvaraṇacitte udaggacitte pasannacitte, atha yā buddhānaṁ sāmukkaṁsikā dhammadesanā, taṁ pakāsesi—
analyzed: yadā te bhagavā aññāsi kalla citte mudu citte vinīvaraṇa citte udagga citte pasanna citte atha yā buddhānam sāmukkasikā dhamma desanā tam pakāsesi
translated: When the Buddha knew that their minds were ready, supple, without hindrances, joyful, and confident, he revealed the teaching unique to the Buddhas:

original: dukkhaṁ samudayaṁ nirodhaṁ maggaṁ.
analyzed: dukkham samudayam nirodham magga
translated: suffering, its origin, its end, and the path.

original: Seyyathāpi nāma suddhaṁ vatthaṁ apagatakāḷakaṁ sammadeva rajanaṁ paṭiggaṇheyya;
analyzed: seyyathā api nāma suddham vattham apagata kāḷakam sammat eva rajanam paṭiggaṇheyya
translated: Just as a clean and stainless cloth absorbs dye properly,

original: evameva tesaṁ caturāsītipāṇasahassānaṁ tasmiṁyeva āsane virajaṁ vītamalaṁ dhammacakkhuṁ udapādi:
analyzed: evam eva tesam catur āsīti pāṇa sahassānam tasmiyā eva āsane virajam vīta malam dhamma cakkhum udapādi
translated: in the same way the four hundred and ninety-nine disciples headed by Yasa, sitting right there, experienced the stainless vision of the Truth:

original: ‘yaṁ kiñci samudayadhammaṁ sabbaṁ taṁ nirodhadhamman’ti.🔽Te diṭṭhadhammā pattadhammā viditadhammā pariyogāḷhadhammā tiṇṇavicikicchā vigatakathaṅkathā
analyzed: yam kiñci samudaya dhammam sabbam tat nirodha dhamman ti  te diṭṭha dhammā patta dhammā vidita dhammā pariyogāḷha dhammā tiṇṇa vicikicchāḥ vigata kathaṅkathāḥ
translated: ‘Anything that has a beginning has an end.’

original: vesārajjappattā aparappaccayā satthusāsane vipassiṁ bhagavantaṁ arahantaṁ sammāsambuddhaṁ etadavocuṁ:
analyzed: vesārajja ppattāḥ apara paccayā satthu sāsane vipassim bhagavantam arahantam sammāsambuddham etat avocuḥ
translated: They had seen the Truth, had reached, understood, and penetrated it. They had gone beyond doubt and uncertainty, had attained to confidence, and had become independent of others in the Teacher’s instruction. They then said to the Buddha,

original: ‘abhikkantaṁ, bhante, abhikkantaṁ, bhante.
analyzed: abhikkanta bhante abhikkanta bhante
translated: ‘Wonderful, Sir, wonderful!

original: Seyyathāpi, bhante, nikkujjitaṁ vā ukkujjeyya, paṭicchannaṁ vā vivareyya, mūḷhassa🔽vā maggaṁ ācikkheyya, andhakāre vā telapajjotaṁ dhāreyya: “cakkhumanto rūpāni dakkhantī”ti;
analyzed: sā iyyathā api bhante nikkujjitam vā ukkujjeyya paṭicchannam vā vivareyya mūḷhassa  vā maggam ācikkheyya andhakāre vā tela pajjotam dhāreyya cakkhumantaḥ rūpāni dakkhanti iti
translated: Just as one might set upright what has been overturned,🔽or reveal what is hidden, or show the way to one who is lost, or bring a lamp into the darkness so that one with eyes might see what is there—🔽just so has the Blessed One—in countless ways—proclaimed the Dhamma.

original: evamevaṁ bhagavatā anekapariyāyena dhammo pakāsito.
analyzed: evam evam bhagavatā aneka pariyāyena dhammo pakāsito
translated: Just as one who had turned over what was overturned, or revealed what was hidden, or shown the path to one who was lost, or brought a lamp into the darkness so that one with eyes might see what’s there— just so has Master Gotama made the Teaching clear in many ways.

original: Ete mayaṁ, bhante, bhagavantaṁ saraṇaṁ gacchāma dhammañca bhikkhusaṅghañca.
analyzed: ete bhante bhagavantam saraṇam gacchāma dhammañca bhikkhu saṅghañca
translated: We go to Master Gotama for refuge and to the Teaching and to the Saṅgha of monks.

original: Labheyyāma mayaṁ, bhante, bhagavato santike pabbajjaṁ labheyyāma upasampadan’ti.
analyzed: labheyyāma bhante bhagavato santike pabbajjam labheyyāma upasampadanti
translated: May Master Gotama remember us as lay followers who have gone to him for refuge, from this day forward, for life.”

original: Alatthuṁ kho, bhikkhave, tāni caturāsītipāṇasahassāni vipassissa bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa santike pabbajjaṁ, alatthuṁ upasampadaṁ.
analyzed: a latthum kho bhikkhave tāni caturāsīti pāṇa sahassāni vipassissa bhagavataḥ arahataḥ sammāsambuddhassa santike pabbajja a latthum upasampada
translated: And those 84,000 people received the going forth in the presence of the Blessed One, the Arahant, the Perfectly Enlightened One. They received the full ordination.

original: Te vipassī bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho dhammiyā kathāya sandassesi samādapesi samuttejesi sampahaṁsesi;
analyzed: te vipassī bhagavā araham sammāsambuddhaḥ dhammiyā kathāya sandassesi samādapesi samuttejesi sampahasesi
translated: The Blessed One instructed, urged, roused, & encouraged them with a Dhamma talk.

original: saṅkhārānaṁ ādīnavaṁ okāraṁ saṅkilesaṁ nibbāne ānisaṁsaṁ pakāsesi.
analyzed: saṅkhārānam ādīnavam okāram saṅkilesam nibbāne ānisasam pakāsesi
translated: He revealed, uncovered, & explained to them the four noble truths.

original: Tesaṁ vipassinā bhagavatā arahatā sammāsambuddhena dhammiyā kathāya sandassiyamānānaṁ
analyzed: tesam vipassinā bhagavatā arahatā sammāsambuddhena dhammiyā kathāya sandassiyamānāna
translated: And as the Lord Buddha Vipassi was instructing, rousing, enthusing, and cheering them with a talk about Nirvana,

original: samādapiyamānānaṁ samuttejiyamānānaṁ sampahaṁsiyamānānaṁ nacirasseva anupādāya āsavehi cittāni vimucciṁsu.
analyzed: samādapiyamānānam samuttejiyamānānam sampahasiyamānānam nacirassa iva an upādāya āsavehi cittāni
translated: their minds were, in no long time, quite freed from the corruptions through letting go of them.

original: 15. Purimapabbajitānaṁ dhammābhisamaya
analyzed: purima pabbajitānam dhamma abhisamaya
translated: The first group of eighty thousand

original: Assosuṁ kho, bhikkhave, tāni purimāni caturāsītipabbajitasahassāni:
analyzed: assosum kho bhikkhave tāni purimāni catur āsīti pabbajita sahassāni
translated: And the first eighty thousand who had gone forth heard that:

original: ‘vipassī kira bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho bandhumatiṁ rājadhāniṁ anuppatto kheme migadāye viharati, dhammañca kira desetī’ti.
analyzed: vipassī kira bhagavā araham sammāsambuddhaḥ bandhumatim rājadhānim an uppatto kheme migadāye viharati dhammañca kira deseti iti
translated: ‘The Lord Buddha Vipassi, they say, has arrived in Bandhumati and is staying in the Khema deer-park, and he is teaching Dhamma.’

original: Atha kho, bhikkhave, tāni caturāsītipabbajitasahassāni yena bandhumatī rājadhānī
analyzed: atha kho bhikkhave tāni catur āsīti pabbajita sahassāni yena bandhumatī rājadhānī
translated: So they went to Bandhumati,

original: yena khemo migadāyo yena vipassī bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho tenupasaṅkamiṁsu;
analyzed: yena khemaḥ migadāyaḥ yena vipassī bhagavā araham sammāsambuddhaḥ tena upasaṅkamisu
translated: to the Khema deer-park, to the Lord Buddha Vipassi,

original: upasaṅkamitvā vipassiṁ bhagavantaṁ arahantaṁ sammāsambuddhaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdiṁsu.
analyzed: upasaṅkamitvā vipassim bhagavantam arahantam sammāsambuddham abhivādetvā ekamantam nisīdisu
translated: and after paying homage to him, they sat down to one side.

original: Tesaṁ vipassī bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho anupubbiṁ kathaṁ kathesi.
analyzed: tesam vipassī bhagavā araham sammāsambuddhaḥ anupubbim katham kathesi
translated: And the Buddha Vipassī gave them a graduated talk:

original: Seyyathidaṁ—dānakathaṁ sīlakathaṁ saggakathaṁ kāmānaṁ ādīnavaṁ okāraṁ saṅkilesaṁ nekkhamme ānisaṁsaṁ pakāsesi.
analyzed: sīla katham sagga katham kāmānam ādīnavam okāram saṅkilesam nekkhamme ānisasam pakāsesi
translated: a talk on generosity, on morality, and on heaven; he explained the danger, degradation, and defilement in worldly pleasures, and the benefit of renunciation.🔽When he knew that their minds were ready, supple, without hindrances, joyful, and confident,

original: Yadā te bhagavā aññāsi kallacitte muducitte vinīvaraṇacitte udaggacitte pasannacitte, atha yā buddhānaṁ sāmukkaṁsikā dhammadesanā, taṁ pakāsesi—
analyzed: yadā te bhagavā aññāsi kalla citte mudu citte vinīvaraṇa citte udagga citte pasanna citte atha yā buddhānam sāmukkasikā dhamma desanā tam pakāsesi
translated: he revealed the teaching unique to the Buddhas:

original: dukkhaṁ samudayaṁ nirodhaṁ maggaṁ.
analyzed: dukkham samudayam nirodham magga
translated: suffering, its origin, its end, and the path.

original: Seyyathāpi nāma suddhaṁ vatthaṁ apagatakāḷakaṁ sammadeva rajanaṁ paṭiggaṇheyya;🔽evameva tesaṁ caturāsītipabbajitasahassānaṁ tasmiṁyeva āsane virajaṁ vītamalaṁ dhammacakkhuṁ udapādi:🔽‘yaṁ kiñci samudayadhammaṁ sabbaṁ taṁ nirodhadhamman’ti.
analyzed: seyyathā api nāma suddham vattham apagata kāḷakam sammat eva rajanam paṭiggaṇheyya  evam eva tesam catur āsīti pabbajita sahassānam tasmiyā eva āsane virajam vīta malam dhamma cakkhum udapādi  yam kiñci samudaya dhammam sabbam tat nirodha dhamman ti
translated: Just as a clean and stainless cloth absorbs dye properly,🔽in the same way, while they were sitting right there, the four assemblies of the Buddha Vipassī saw the truths.🔽They saw the noble truths of suffering, its origin, its end, and the path.

original: Te diṭṭhadhammā pattadhammā viditadhammā pariyogāḷhadhammā tiṇṇavicikicchā vigatakathaṅkathā
analyzed: te diṭṭha dhammā patta dhammā vidita dhammā pariyogāḷha dhammā tiṇṇa vicikicchāḥ vigata kathaṅkathāḥ
translated: They had seen the truth, had reached, understood, and penetrated it. They had gone beyond doubt and uncertainty, had attained to confidence, and had become independent of others in the Teacher’s instruction.

original: vesārajjappattā aparappaccayā satthusāsane vipassiṁ bhagavantaṁ arahantaṁ sammāsambuddhaṁ etadavocuṁ:
analyzed: vesārajja ppattāḥ apara paccayā satthu sāsane vipassim bhagavantam arahantam sammāsambuddham etat avocuḥ
translated: and, having gained confidence in the Fortunate One, they said this to the Fortunate One:

original: ‘abhikkantaṁ, bhante, abhikkantaṁ, bhante.
analyzed: abhikkanta bhante abhikkanta bhante
translated: ‘Excellent, venerable Sir! Excellent, venerable Sir!

original: Seyyathāpi, bhante, nikkujjitaṁ vā ukkujjeyya, paṭicchannaṁ vā vivareyya, mūḷhassa
analyzed: sā iyyathā api bhante nikkujjitam vā ukkujjeyya paṭicchannam vā vivareyya mūḷhassa
translated: Just as, venerable Sir, one might set upright what has been overturned,

original: vā maggaṁ ācikkheyya, andhakāre vā telapajjotaṁ dhāreyya: “cakkhumanto rūpāni dakkhantī”ti;
analyzed: vā maggam ācikkheyya andhakāre vā tela pajjotam dhāreyya cakkhumantaḥ rūpāni dakkhanti iti
translated: or open up what has been closed, or show a path to one who is lost, or bring an oil-lamp into the darkness, (thinking): ‘those with vision will see forms’,

original: evamevaṁ bhagavatā anekapariyāyena dhammo pakāsito.
analyzed: evam evam bhagavatā aneka pariyāyena dhammo pakāsito
translated: just so has the Dhamma been explained by the Fortunate One in countless ways.

original: Ete mayaṁ, bhante, bhagavantaṁ saraṇaṁ gacchāma dhammañca bhikkhusaṅghañca.
analyzed: ete bhante bhagavantam saraṇam gacchāma dhammañca bhikkhu saṅghañca
translated: We go, venerable Sir, to the Fortunate One for refuge, and to the Dhamma, and to the Community of monks.

original: Labheyyāma mayaṁ, bhante, bhagavato santike pabbajjaṁ labheyyāma upasampadan’ti.
analyzed: labheyyāma bhante bhagavato santike pabbajjam labheyyāma upasampadanti
translated: May we receive the going-forth, venerable Sir, in the presence of the Fortunate One, may we receive the full ordination.’

original: Alatthuṁ kho, bhikkhave, tāni caturāsītipabbajitasahassāni vipassissa bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa santike pabbajjaṁ alatthuṁ upasampadaṁ.
analyzed: a latthum kho bhikkhave tāni catur āsīti pabbajita sahassāni vipassissa bhagavataḥ arahataḥ sammāsambuddhassa santike pabbajjam a latthum upasampadaḥ
translated: And those eighty-four thousand who had gone forth received the full ordination in the Fortunate One’s presence.

original: Te vipassī bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho dhammiyā kathāya sandassesi samādapesi samuttejesi sampahaṁsesi;🔽saṅkhārānaṁ ādīnavaṁ okāraṁ saṅkilesaṁ nibbāne ānisaṁsaṁ pakāsesi.
analyzed: te vipassī bhagavā araham sammāsambuddhaḥ dhammiyā kathāya sandassesi samādapesi samuttejesi sampahasesi  saṅkhārānam ādīnavam okāram saṅkilesam nibbāne ānisasam pakāsesi
translated: The Lord Buddha Vipassi instructed, inspired, fired and delighted them with a talk on Dhamma.🔽He expounded to them the Dhamma in its gradual sequence:

original: Tesaṁ vipassinā bhagavatā arahatā sammāsambuddhena dhammiyā kathāya sandassiyamānānaṁ
analyzed: tesam vipassinā bhagavatā arahatā sammāsambuddhena dhammiyā kathāya sandassiyamānāna
translated: and when they were established in the Refuges and Precepts, he expounded to them the Dhamma in its gradual sequence:

original: samādapiyamānānaṁ samuttejiyamānānaṁ sampahaṁsiyamānānaṁ nacirasseva anupādāya āsavehi cittāni vimucciṁsu.
analyzed: samādapiyamānānam samuttejiyamānānam sampahasiyamānānam nacirassa iva an upādāya āsavehi cittāni
translated: and their minds were quickly freed from the corruptions without grasping.

original: 16. Cārikāanujānana
translated: 1. The permission to wander

original: Tena kho pana, bhikkhave, samayena bandhumatiyā rājadhāniyā mahābhikkhusaṅgho paṭivasati aṭṭhasaṭṭhibhikkhusatasahassaṁ.
analyzed: tena kho pana bhikkhave samayena bandhumatiyāḥ rājadhāniyāḥ mahā bhikkhu saṅghaḥ paṭivasati aṭṭhasaṭṭhi bhikkhu sata sahassa
translated: Now at that time a great community of monks was dwelling in Bandhumati, 600,000 monks.

original: Atha kho, bhikkhave, vipassissa bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa rahogatassa paṭisallīnassa evaṁ cetaso parivitakko udapādi:
analyzed: atha kho bhikkhave vipassissa bhagavataḥ arahataḥ sammāsambuddhassa rahogatassa paṭisallīnassa evam cetasaḥ parivitakkaḥ udapādi
translated: Then, as the Lord Buddha Vipassi was meditating in seclusion, he thought thus:

original: ‘mahā kho etarahi bhikkhusaṅgho bandhumatiyā rājadhāniyā paṭivasati aṭṭhasaṭṭhibhikkhusatasahassaṁ, yannūnāhaṁ bhikkhū anujāneyyaṁ:
analyzed: mahā kho etarahi bhikkhu saṅghaḥ bandhumatiyā rājadhāniyā paṭivasati aṭṭhasaṭṭhi bhikkhu sata sahassa yat nūna aham bhikkhū anujāneyya
translated: ‘The Sangha of monks staying at Bandhumati is very large—6,800,000 monks. Let me ask the monks for permission to🔽

original: “caratha, bhikkhave, cārikaṁ bahujanahitāya bahujanasukhāya lokānukampāya atthāya hitāya sukhāya devamanussānaṁ;
analyzed: caratha bhikkhave cārikam bahu jana hitāya bahu jana sukhāya loka anukampāya atthāya hitāya sukhāya deva manussāna
translated: ‘The Sangha of monks is now very large—6.8 million monks. Let me allow the monks to go wandering for the benefit of many people, for the happiness of many people, out of sympathy for the world, for the welfare, benefit, and happiness of devas and humans.

original: mā ekena dve agamittha;
analyzed: mā ekena dve agamittha
translated: Don’t two go by the same path.

original: desetha, bhikkhave, dhammaṁ ādikalyāṇaṁ majjhekalyāṇaṁ pariyosānakalyāṇaṁ sātthaṁ sabyañjanaṁ kevalaparipuṇṇaṁ parisuddhaṁ brahmacariyaṁ pakāsetha.
analyzed: desetha bhikkhave dhammam ādi kalyāṇam majjhe kalyāṇam pariyosāna kalyāṇam sa attham sa byañjanam kevala paripuṇṇam parisuddham brahmacariyam pakāsetha
translated: Teach the Dhamma that’s good in the beginning, good in the middle, and good in the end, with the right meaning and phrasing. And reveal a holy life that’s perfectly complete and pure.

original: Santi sattā apparajakkhajātikā, assavanatā dhammassa parihāyanti,
analyzed: santi sattā appara jakkha jātikāḥ a savana tā dhammassa parihāyanti
translated: There are beings with little dust on the eyes who are perishing through failing to hear the Dhamma.

original: bhavissanti dhammassa aññātāro.
analyzed: bhavissanti dhammassa aññātāro
translated: There will be those who understand the Teaching.’

original: Api ca channaṁ channaṁ vassānaṁ accayena bandhumatī rājadhānī upasaṅkamitabbā pātimokkhuddesāyā”’ti.
analyzed: api ca channam channam vassānam accayena bandhumatī rājadhānī upasaṅkamitabbā pātimokkha uddesāya ati
translated: And after six years had passed, I said to Venerable Ānanda, ‘Ānanda, after six years have passed, the Sangha of monks is to return to Bandhumatī for the recitation of the Monastic Code.’”

original: Atha kho, bhikkhave, aññataro mahābrahmā vipassissa bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa
analyzed: atha kho bhikkhave aññataraḥ mahābrahmā vipassissa bhagavataḥ arahataḥ sammāsambuddhassa
translated: Then a certain great brahmā,

original: cetasā cetoparivitakkamaññāya seyyathāpi nāma balavā puriso samiñjitaṁ vā bāhaṁ pasāreyya,🔽pasāritaṁ vā bāhaṁ samiñjeyya; evameva—brahmaloke antarahito vipassissa bhagavato
analyzed: cetasā cetaḥ upari vitakkam aññāya seyyathā api nāma balavā purisaḥ samiñjitam vā bāham pasāreyya  pasāritam vā bāham samiñjeyya evam eva brahma loke antarahitaḥ vipassissa bhagavataḥ
translated: knowing with his mind the reflection in the mind of Vipassī, the Blessed One, the Arahant, the Perfectly Enlightened One,

original: arahato sammāsambuddhassa purato pāturahosi.
analyzed: arahataḥ sammāsambuddhassa puratas pāturahosi
translated: just as a strong man might extend his flexed arm or flex his extended arm, disappeared from the brahmā world and reappeared in front of Vipassī, the Blessed One, the Arahant, the Perfectly Enlightened One.

original: Atha kho so, bhikkhave, mahābrahmā ekaṁsaṁ uttarāsaṅgaṁ karitvā yena vipassī bhagavā
analyzed: atha kho saḥ bhikkhave mahābrahmā ekasam uttarāsaṅgam karitvā yena vipassī bhagavā
translated: Then that great brahmā, arranging his upper robe on one shoulder,

original: arahaṁ sammāsambuddho tenañjaliṁ paṇāmetvā vipassiṁ bhagavantaṁ arahantaṁ sammāsambuddhaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: araham sammāsambuddhaḥ tena añjalim paṇāmetvā vipassim bhagavantam arahantam sammāsambuddham etat avoca
translated: extended his hands in reverential salutation towards Vipassī, the Blessed One, the Arahant, the Perfectly Enlightened One, and said to him:

original: ‘evametaṁ, bhagavā, evametaṁ, sugata.
analyzed: evam eta bhagavā evam eta sugata
translated: ‘So it is, Blessed One! So it is, Sublime One!

original: Mahā kho, bhante, etarahi bhikkhusaṅgho bandhumatiyā rājadhāniyā paṭivasati aṭṭhasaṭṭhibhikkhusatasahassaṁ, anujānātu, bhante, bhagavā bhikkhū:
analyzed: mahā kho bhante etarahi bhikkhu saṅghaḥ bandhumatiyā rājadhāniyā paṭivasati aṭṭhasaṭṭhi bhikkhu sata sahassa anujānātu bhante bhagavā bhikkhū
translated: At present, Lord, the Sangha of bhikkhus is staying at Bandhumati, that is, six hundred thousand bhikkhus. May the Blessed One consent, Lord, to eat a meal on the way with the Sangha of bhikkhus.

original: “caratha, bhikkhave, cārikaṁ bahujanahitāya bahujanasukhāya lokānukampāya atthāya hitāya sukhāya devamanussānaṁ;
analyzed: caratha bhikkhave cārikam bahu jana hitāya bahu jana sukhāya loka anukampāya atthāya hitāya sukhāya deva manussāna
translated: “Wander, monks, on a tour of the countryside for the benefit and welfare of both humanity and the gods, out of compassion for the world, for the good, welfare, and happiness of gods and humans.

original: mā ekena dve agamittha;
analyzed: mā ekena dve agamittha
translated: But don’t two of you go the same way.

original: desetha, bhikkhave, dhammaṁ ādikalyāṇaṁ majjhekalyāṇaṁ pariyosānakalyāṇaṁ sātthaṁ sabyañjanaṁ kevalaparipuṇṇaṁ parisuddhaṁ brahmacariyaṁ pakāsetha.
analyzed: desetha bhikkhave dhammam ādi kalyāṇam majjhe kalyāṇam pariyosāna kalyāṇam sa attham sa byañjanam kevala paripuṇṇam parisuddham brahmacariyam pakāsetha
translated: Proclaim the Dhamma that is lovely in its beginning, lovely in its middle, and lovely in its ending, both in the spirit and in the letter, and display the holy life fully complete and pube perfect.

original: Santi sattā apparajakkhajātikā, assavanatā dhammassa parihāyanti, bhavissanti dhammassa aññātāro”ti.
analyzed: santi sattā appara jakkha jātikā a savana tā dhammassa parihāyanti bhavissanti dhammassa aññātāro ti
translated: There are beings with little dust on the eyes who are perishing through not hearing the Dhamma. There will be those who will understand the Dhamma.”

original: Api ca, bhante, mayaṁ tathā karissāma yathā bhikkhū channaṁ channaṁ vassānaṁ accayena bandhumatiṁ rājadhāniṁ upasaṅkamissanti pātimokkhuddesāyā’ti.
analyzed: api ca bhante mayam tathā karissāma yathā bhikkhū channam channam vassānam accayena bandhumatim rājadhānim upasaṅkamissanti pātimokkha uddesāya ati
translated: And, Lord, we will see to it that after the elapse of six years the monks will return to Bandhumati to recite the Pāṭimokkha.”

original: Idamavoca, bhikkhave, so mahābrahmā.
analyzed: idam avoca bhikkhave saḥ mahābrahmā
translated: This, monks, is what that great brahmā said.

original: Idaṁ vatvā vipassiṁ bhagavantaṁ arahantaṁ sammāsambuddhaṁ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṁ katvā tattheva antaradhāyi.
analyzed: idam vatvā vipassim bhagavantam arahantam sammāsambuddham abhivādetvā padakkhiṇam katvā tattha eva antaradhāyi
translated: And after saying it, he paid homage to me, keeping me on his right, and then vanished right there.

original: Atha kho, bhikkhave, vipassī bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho sāyanhasamayaṁ paṭisallānā vuṭṭhito bhikkhū āmantesi:
analyzed: atha kho bhikkhave vipassī bhagavā araham sammāsambuddhaḥ sāyanha samayam paṭisallānā vuṭṭhitaḥ bhikkhū āmantesi
translated: Then, when it was evening, the Buddha came out of his secluded dwelling place and addressed the monks:

original: ‘idha mayhaṁ, bhikkhave, rahogatassa paṭisallīnassa evaṁ cetaso parivitakko udapādi:
analyzed: idha bhikkhave rahogatassa paṭisallīnassa evam cetasaḥ parivitakkaḥ udapādi
translated: ‘Monks, this thought came to me in seclusion:

original: “mahā kho etarahi bhikkhusaṅgho bandhumatiyā rājadhāniyā paṭivasati aṭṭhasaṭṭhibhikkhusatasahassaṁ.🔽Yannūnāhaṁ bhikkhū anujāneyyaṁ—
analyzed: mahā kho etarahi bhikkhu saṅghaḥ bandhumatiyā rājadhāniyā paṭivasati aṭṭhasaṭṭhi bhikkhu sata sahassa  yat nūna aham bhikkhū anujāneyya
translated: “The Sangha of monks is large — 1,250,000 monks.

original: caratha, bhikkhave, cārikaṁ bahujanahitāya bahujanasukhāya lokānukampāya atthāya hitāya sukhāya devamanussānaṁ;
analyzed: caratha bhikkhave cārikam bahu jana hitāya bahu jana sukhāya loka anukampāya atthāya hitāya sukhāya deva manussāna
translated: Let me allow the monks to go wandering for the benefit of many people, for the happiness of many people, out of sympathy for the world, for the welfare, benefit, and happiness of devas and humans.

original: mā ekena dve agamittha;
analyzed: mā ekena dve agamittha
translated: But don’t two go by the same path.

original: desetha, bhikkhave, dhammaṁ ādikalyāṇaṁ majjhekalyāṇaṁ pariyosānakalyāṇaṁ sātthaṁ sabyañjanaṁ kevalaparipuṇṇaṁ parisuddhaṁ brahmacariyaṁ pakāsetha.
analyzed: desetha bhikkhave dhammam ādi kalyāṇam majjhe kalyāṇam pariyosāna kalyāṇam sa attham sa byañjanam kevala paripuṇṇam parisuddham brahmacariyam pakāsetha
translated: Teach the Dhamma that’s good in the beginning, good in the middle, and good in the end, with the right meaning and phrasing. And reveal a holy life that’s entirely perfect and pure.”

original: Santi sattā apparajakkhajātikā, assavanatā dhammassa parihāyanti, bhavissanti dhammassa aññātāro.
analyzed: santi sattā appara jakkha jātikā a savana tā dhammassa parihāyanti bhavissanti dhammassa aññātāro
translated: There are beings with little dust on the eyes who are perishing because they do not hear the Dhamma. There will be those who will understand the Dhamma.

original: Api ca channaṁ channaṁ vassānaṁ accayena bandhumatī rājadhānī upasaṅkamitabbā pātimokkhuddesāyā”’ti.
analyzed: api ca channam channam vassānam accayena bandhumatī rājadhānī upasaṅkamitabbā pātimokkha uddesāya ati
translated: But after six years have passed, you should return to Bandhumati for the recitation of the Monastic Code.’

original: Atha kho, bhikkhave, aññataro mahābrahmā mama cetasā cetoparivitakkamaññāya seyyathāpi
analyzed: atha kho bhikkhave aññataraḥ mahābrahmā mama cetasā cetaḥ upari vitakka maññāya seyyathā api
translated: Then a certain great brahma, knowing with his mind the thoughts in the mind of the Buddha, disappeared from the brahma world and reappeared in front of the Buddha,

original: nāma balavā puriso samiñjitaṁ vā bāhaṁ pasāreyya, pasāritaṁ vā bāhaṁ samiñjeyya;🔽evameva—brahmaloke antarahito mama purato pāturahosi.
analyzed: nāma balavā purisaḥ samiñjitam vā bāham pasāreyya pasāritam vā bāham samiñjeyya  evam eva brahma loke antara hitaḥ mama puratas
translated: just as a strong man might extend his flexed arm or flex his extended arm.

original: Atha kho so, bhikkhave, mahābrahmā ekaṁsaṁ uttarāsaṅgaṁ karitvā yenāhaṁ tenañjaliṁ paṇāmetvā maṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: atha kho saḥ bhikkhave mahābrahmā ekasam uttarāsaṅgam karitvā yena aham tena añjalim paṇāmetvā mama etat avoca
translated: He arranged his upper robe over one shoulder, raised his joined palms, and said to the Buddha,

original: ‘evametaṁ, bhagavā, evametaṁ, sugata.
analyzed: evam eta bhagavā evam eta sugata
translated: ‘It is so, Blessed One. It is so, Happy One.

original: Mahā kho, bhante, etarahi bhikkhusaṅgho bandhumatiyā rājadhāniyā paṭivasati aṭṭhasaṭṭhibhikkhusatasahassaṁ.
analyzed: mahā kho bhante etarahi bhikkhu saṅghaḥ bandhumatiyā rājadhāniyā paṭivasati aṭṭhasaṭṭhi bhikkhu sata sahassa
translated: The Sangha of monks is now staying in Bandhumati, a hundred and twenty thousand strong.

original: Anujānātu, bhante, bhagavā bhikkhū—
analyzed: anujānātu bhante bhagavā bhikkhū
translated: Please give your permission, Sir, for the monks to do this.

original: caratha, bhikkhave, cārikaṁ bahujanahitāya bahujanasukhāya lokānukampāya atthāya hitāya sukhāya devamanussānaṁ;
analyzed: caratha bhikkhave cārikam bahu jana hitāya bahu jana sukhāya loka anukampāya atthāya hitāya sukhāya deva manussāna
translated: Go forth, monks, for the benefit of the many, for the happiness of the many, out of compassion for the world, for the welfare, benefit, and happiness of devas and humans.

original: mā ekena dve agamittha;
analyzed: mā ekena dve agamittha
translated: Don’t go two of you the same way.

original: desetha, bhikkhave, dhammaṁ …pe…
analyzed: desetha bhikkhave dhammaṃ pe
translated: Teach the Dhamma that’s good in the beginning, good in the middle, and good in the end, with the right meaning and phrasing. And reveal a spiritual practice that’s entirely full and pure.

original: santi sattā apparajakkhajātikā, assavanatā dhammassa parihāyanti, bhavissanti dhammassa aññātāroti.
analyzed: santi sattā appara jakkha jātikā a savana tā dhammassa parihāyanti bhavissanti dhammassa aññātāro ti
translated: There are beings with little dust on the eyes who are perishing through not hearing the Teaching. There will be those who understand the Teaching.’

original: Api ca, bhante, mayaṁ tathā karissāma, yathā bhikkhū channaṁ channaṁ vassānaṁ accayena bandhumatiṁ rājadhāniṁ upasaṅkamissanti pātimokkhuddesāyā’ti.
analyzed: api ca bhante mayam tathā karissāma yathā bhikkhū channam channam vassānam accayena bandhumatim rājadhānim upasaṅkamissanti pātimokkha uddesāya ati
translated: And, Sir, we’ll make sure that after six years the monks return to Bandhumati to recite the Teaching.”

original: Idamavoca, bhikkhave, so mahābrahmā.
analyzed: idam avoca bhikkhave saḥ mahābrahmā
translated: This is what that great brahma said.

original: Idaṁ vatvā maṁ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṁ katvā tattheva antaradhāyi.
analyzed: idam vatvā mam abhivādetvā padakkhiṇam katvā tattha iva antaradhāyi
translated: After saying this, he bowed down, circumambulated me with his right side toward me, and disappeared right there.

original: ‘Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, caratha cārikaṁ bahujanahitāya bahujanasukhāya lokānukampāya atthāya hitāya sukhāya devamanussānaṁ;
analyzed: anujānāmi bhikkhave caratha cārikam bahu jana hitāya bahu jana sukhāya loka anukampāya atthāya hitāya sukhāya deva manussāna
translated: ‘I allow you to go forth, monks, for the benefit of the many, for the happiness of the many, out of compassion for the world, for the welfare, benefit, and happiness of devas and humans.

original: mā ekena dve agamittha;
analyzed: mā ekena dve agamittha
translated: Don’t go in pairs,

original: desetha, bhikkhave, dhammaṁ ādikalyāṇaṁ majjhekalyāṇaṁ pariyosānakalyāṇaṁ sātthaṁ sabyañjanaṁ kevalaparipuṇṇaṁ parisuddhaṁ brahmacariyaṁ pakāsetha.
analyzed: desetha bhikkhave dhammam ādi kalyāṇam majjhe kalyāṇam pariyosāna kalyāṇam sa attham sa byañjanam kevala paripuṇṇam parisuddham brahmacariyam pakāsetha
translated: but teach the Dhamma that is lovely in its beginning, lovely in its middle, and lovely in its ending, both in the letter and in the spirit, and display the holy life fully complete and perfect.

original: Santi sattā apparajakkhajātikā, assavanatā dhammassa parihāyanti,
analyzed: santi sattā appara jakkha jātikāḥ a savana tā dhammassa parihāyanti
translated: There are beings with little dust on the eyes who are perishing through not hearing the Dhamma.

original: bhavissanti dhammassa aññātāro.
analyzed: bhavissanti dhammassa aññātāro
translated: There will be those who will understand the Dhamma.

original: Api ca, bhikkhave, channaṁ channaṁ vassānaṁ accayena bandhumatī rājadhānī upasaṅkamitabbā pātimokkhuddesāyā’ti.
analyzed: api ca bhikkhave channam channam vassānam accayena bandhumatī rājadhānī upasaṅkamitabbā pātimokkha uddesāya ati
translated: But, monks, after six years have passed, you should return to Bandhumati to recite the Monastic Code.’

original: Atha kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhū yebhuyyena ekāheneva janapadacārikaṁ pakkamiṁsu.
analyzed: atha kho bhikkhave bhikkhū yebhuyyena ekāhena iva janapada cārikam pakkamisu
translated: And most of the monks left on a wandering tour of the country.

original: Tena kho pana samayena jambudīpe caturāsīti āvāsasahassāni honti.
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena jambudīpe caturāsīti āvāsa sahassāni honti
translated: At that time there were 84,000 inhabited places in India.

original: Ekamhi hi vasse nikkhante devatā saddamanussāvesuṁ:
analyzed: ekamhi hi vasse nikkhante devatā sadda manussāvesu
translated: When one year had passed, the gods announced,

original: ‘nikkhantaṁ kho, mārisā, ekaṁ vassaṁ;
analyzed: nikkhantam kho mārisā ekam vassa
translated: ‘One year has passed, sirs.

original: pañca dāni vassāni sesāni;
analyzed: pañca dāni vassāni sesāni
translated: There are now five years left.

original: pañcannaṁ vassānaṁ accayena bandhumatī rājadhānī upasaṅkamitabbā pātimokkhuddesāyā’ti.
analyzed: pañcannam vassānam accayena bandhumatī rājadhānī upasaṅkamitabbā pātimokkha uddesāya ati
translated: When five years have passed, you should go to the capital Bandhumatī to recite the Monastic Code.’

original: Dvīsu vassesu nikkhantesu …
analyzed: dvīsu vassesu nikkhantesu
translated: When two years had passed, …

original: tīsu vassesu nikkhantesu …
analyzed: tīsu vassesu nikkhantesu
translated: when three years had passed, …

original: catūsu vassesu nikkhantesu …
analyzed: catūsu vassesu nikkhantesu
translated: when four years had passed, …

original: pañcasu vassesu nikkhantesu devatā saddamanussāvesuṁ:
analyzed: pañcasu vassesu nikkhantesu devatā sadda manussāvesu
translated: when five years had passed, the deities announced:

original: ‘nikkhantāni kho, mārisā, pañcavassāni;🔽ekaṁ dāni vassaṁ sesaṁ;
analyzed: nikkhantāni kho mārisā pañca vassāni  ekam dāni vassam sesa
translated: ‘Good sirs, five years have passed.🔽There is one year left.

original: ekassa vassassa accayena bandhumatī rājadhānī upasaṅkamitabbā pātimokkhuddesāyā’ti.
analyzed: ekassa vassassa accayena bandhumatī rājadhānī upasaṅkamitabbā pātimokkha uddesāya ati
translated: When that year has passed, you should go to the capital Bandhumatī to recite the Monastic Code.’

original: Chasu vassesu nikkhantesu devatā saddamanussāvesuṁ:
analyzed: chasu vassesu nikkhantesu devatā sadda manussāvesu
translated: When six years had passed, the deities announced:

original: ‘nikkhantāni kho, mārisā, chabbassāni,
analyzed: nikkhantāni kho mārisā chabbassāni
translated: ‘Good sirs, six years have passed.

original: samayo dāni bandhumatiṁ rājadhāniṁ upasaṅkamituṁ pātimokkhuddesāyā’ti.
analyzed: samayaḥ dāni bandhumatim rājadhānim upasaṅkamitum pātimokkha uddesāya ati
translated: It’s time to go to the capital Bandhumatī to recite the Monastic Code.’

original: Atha kho te, bhikkhave, bhikkhū appekacce sakena iddhānubhāvena appekacce devatānaṁ iddhānubhāvena ekāheneva bandhumatiṁ rājadhāniṁ upasaṅkamiṁsu pātimokkhuddesāyāti.
analyzed: atha kho te bhikkhave bhikkhū appekacce sakena iddha anubhāvena appekacce devatānam iddha anubhāvena eka ahena iva bandhumatim rājadhānim upasaṅkamisu pātimokkha uddesāya ati
translated: Then, some of those monks went to Bandhumati, the capital, by their own psychic power, and some by the psychic power of the gods, in order to recite the Monastic Code.

original: Tatra sudaṁ, bhikkhave, vipassī bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho bhikkhusaṅghe evaṁ pātimokkhaṁ uddisati:🔽‘Khantī paramaṁ tapo titikkhā,
analyzed: tatra suda bhikkhave vipassī bhagavā araham sammāsambuddhaḥ bhikkhu saṅghe evam pātimokkham uddisati  khantī paramam tapaḥ titikkhā
translated: There the Buddha Vipassi recited the Monastic Code like this:

original: Nibbānaṁ paramaṁ vadanti buddhā;🔽Na hi pabbajito parūpaghātī,
analyzed: nibbānam paramam vadanti buddhāḥ  na hi pabbajitaḥ parūpa ghātī
translated: ‘Patience is the highest austerity; Nibbāna is the highest say the Buddhas.

original: Na samaṇo hoti paraṁ viheṭhayanto.
analyzed: na samaṇaḥ hoti param viheṭhayantaḥ
translated: One who harms another is not an ascetic; One who harasses another is not a monastic.

original: Sabbapāpassa akaraṇaṁ,🔽kusalassa upasampadā;
analyzed: sabba pāpassa a karaṇa  kusalassa upasampadā
translated: Not doing any evil,🔽practicing what is skillful,

original: Sacittapariyodapanaṁ,
analyzed: sa citta pariyodapana
translated: purifying one’s mind:

original: etaṁ buddhānasāsanaṁ.
analyzed: etam buddhān asāsana
translated: this is the teaching of the Buddhas.

original: Anūpavādo anūpaghāto,🔽Pātimokkhe ca saṁvaro;
analyzed: anūpavādaḥ anūpaghātaḥ  pātimokkhe ca savaraḥ
translated: Not criticizing, not harming,🔽restraint in the Monastic Code,🔽moderation in food,

original: Mattaññutā ca bhattasmiṁ,🔽Pantañca sayanāsanaṁ;
analyzed: mattaññu tā ca  pantañca sayanāsana
translated: dwelling in seclusion,

original: Adhicitte ca āyogo,
analyzed: adhicitte ca āyogaḥ
translated: dedication to meditation:

original: Etaṁ buddhānasāsanan’ti.
analyzed: etam
translated: this is the teaching of the Buddhas.’

original: 17. Devatārocana
analyzed: devatā rocana
translated: The gods’ invitation

original: Ekamidāhaṁ, bhikkhave, samayaṁ ukkaṭṭhāyaṁ viharāmi subhagavane sālarājamūle.
analyzed: ekam idam āha bhikkhave samayam ukkaṭṭhāyam viharāmi subhaga vane sālarājamūle
translated: I stayed in the Subhaga forest at Ukkatthā, at the root of a royal sāla tree.

original: Tassa mayhaṁ, bhikkhave, rahogatassa paṭisallīnassa evaṁ cetaso parivitakko udapādi:
analyzed: tassa bhikkhave rahogatassa paṭisallīnassa evam cetasaḥ parivitakkaḥ udapādi
translated: While I was staying there, this train of thought appeared in my awareness:

original: ‘na kho so sattāvāso sulabharūpo, yo mayā anāvutthapubbo iminā dīghena addhunā aññatra suddhāvāsehi devehi.
analyzed: na kho so sattāvāsaḥ sulabha rūpaḥ yaḥ mayā an āvuttha pubbaḥ iminā dīghena addhunā aññatra suddhāvāsehi devehi
translated: ‘It’s not easy to find a place where I haven’t stayed during this long period, except for the gods of the pure abodes.

original: Yannūnāhaṁ yena suddhāvāsā devā tenupasaṅkameyyan’ti.🔽Atha khvāhaṁ, bhikkhave, seyyathāpi nāma balavā puriso samiñjitaṁ vā bāhaṁ pasāreyya,
analyzed: yat nūna aham yena suddhāvāsā devā tena upasaṅkameyyanti  atha khvā āha bhikkhave seyyathā api nāma balavā purisaḥ samiñjitam vā bāham pasāreyya
translated: Why don’t I go to the gods of the pure abodes?’

original: pasāritaṁ vā bāhaṁ samiñjeyya; evameva—ukkaṭṭhāyaṁ subhagavane sālarājamūle antarahito
analyzed: pasāritam vā bāham samiñjeyya evam eva okkaṭṭhāyam subhaga vane sāla rājamūle
translated: So, just as a strong man might extend his flexed arm or flex his extended arm, I disappeared from the Subhaga forest at Ukkatthā

original: avihesu devesu pāturahosiṁ.
analyzed: avihesu devesu
translated: and reappeared among the Aviha gods.

original: Tasmiṁ, bhikkhave, devanikāye anekāni devatāsahassāni anekāni devatāsatasahassāni
analyzed: tasmi bhikkhave devanikāye anekāni devatā sahassāni anekāni devatā sata sahassāni
translated: In that god-world many thousands of gods, many hundreds of thousands of gods

original: yenāhaṁ tenupasaṅkamiṁsu; upasaṅkamitvā maṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ aṭṭhaṁsu. Ekamantaṁ
analyzed: yena aham tena upasaṅkamisu upasaṅkamitvā mam abhivādetvā ekamantam aṭṭhasu ekamanta
translated: approached me. They bowed down to me and stood to one side.

original: ṭhitā kho, bhikkhave, tā devatā maṁ etadavocuṁ:
analyzed: ṭhitāḥ kho bhikkhave tāḥ devatāḥ mama etat avocuḥ
translated: and they said to me:

original: ‘ito so, mārisā, ekanavutikappe yaṁ vipassī bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho loke udapādi.
analyzed: itas saḥ mārisāḥ ekanavuti kappe yam vipassī bhagavā araham sammāsambuddhaḥ loke udapādi
translated: ‘Good sir, ninety-one aeons ago the Lord Buddha Vipassī arose in the world.

original: Vipassī, mārisā, bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho khattiyo jātiyā ahosi, khattiyakule udapādi.
analyzed: vipassī mārisā bhagavā araham sammāsambuddhaḥ khattiyaḥ jātiyā ahosi khattiya kule udapādi
translated: The Lord Buddha Vipassī was of princely descent, he arose in a princely family.

original: Vipassī, mārisā, bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho koṇḍañño gottena ahosi.
analyzed: vipassī mārisā bhagavā araham sammāsambuddhaḥ koṇḍaññaḥ gottena ahosi
translated: The Lord Buddha Vipassī was of the Koṇḍañña clan.

original: Vipassissa, mārisā, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa asītivassasahassāni āyuppamāṇaṁ ahosi.
analyzed: vipassissa mārisā bhagavataḥ arahataḥ sammāsambuddhassa asīti vassa sahassāni āyu ppamāṇam ahosi
translated: The Lord Buddha Vipassī’s lifespan was eighty-four thousand years.

original: Vipassī, mārisā, bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho pāṭaliyā mūle abhisambuddho.🔽Vipassissa, mārisā, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa khaṇḍatissaṁ nāma sāvakayugaṁ ahosi aggaṁ bhaddayugaṁ.
analyzed: vipassī mārisā bhagavā araham sammāsambuddhaḥ pāṭaliyā mūle abhisambuddhaḥ  vipassissa mārisā bhagavataḥ arahataḥ sammāsambuddhassa khaṇḍatissam nāma sāvaka yugam ahosi aggam bhadda yuga
translated: The Lord Buddha Vipassī was awakened at the foot of a trumpet-flower tree.🔽The Lord Buddha Vipassī’s chief disciples were called Khaṇḍa and Tissa.

original: Vipassissa, mārisā, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa tayo sāvakānaṁ sannipātā
analyzed: vipassissa mārisāḥ bhagavataḥ arahataḥ sammāsambuddhassa tayo sāvakānam sannipātā
translated: The Lord Buddha Vipassī had three assemblies of disciples.

original: ahesuṁ. Eko sāvakānaṁ sannipāto ahosi aṭṭhasaṭṭhibhikkhusatasahassaṁ. Eko sāvakānaṁ
analyzed: ekaḥ sāvakānam sannipātaḥ ahosi aṭṭhasaṭṭhi bhikkhu sata sahasse ekaḥ sāvakāna
translated: There was one assembly of disciples: 6,800,000 bhikkhus.

original: sannipāto ahosi bhikkhusatasahassaṁ. Eko sāvakānaṁ sannipāto ahosi asītibhikkhusahassāni.
analyzed: sannipātaḥ ahosi bhikkhu sata sahassaḥ ekaḥ sāvakānam sannipātaḥ ahosi asīti bhikkhu sahassāni
translated: There were three assemblies of his disciples, all of them Arahants. One assembly of disciples numbered 6,800,000 Arahants. Another assembly of disciples numbered 100,000 Arahants. Another assembly of disciples numbered 80,000 Arahants.

original: Vipassissa, mārisā, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa ime tayo sāvakānaṁ sannipātā🔽ahesuṁ sabbesaṁyeva khīṇāsavānaṁ.
analyzed: vipassissa mārisāḥ bhagavataḥ arahataḥ sammāsambuddhassa ime tayo sāvakānam sannipātā  ahesum sabbesayā iva khīṇa āsavāna
translated: These were the three assemblies of disciples of the Lord Buddha Vipassi, all of them Arahants.

original: Vipassissa, mārisā, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa asoko nāma bhikkhu upaṭṭhāko ahosi aggupaṭṭhāko.
analyzed: vipassissa mārisā bhagavataḥ arahataḥ sammāsambuddhassa asokaḥ nāma bhikkhu upaṭṭhākaḥ ahosi aggupaṭṭhāko
translated: The Lord Buddha Vipassi’s chief attendant was the monk Asoka,

original: Vipassissa, mārisā, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa bandhumā nāma rājā pitā ahosi.
analyzed: vipassissa mārisā bhagavataḥ arahataḥ sammāsambuddhassa bandhumā nāma rājā pitā ahosi
translated: The Lord Buddha Vipassi’s father was King Bandhuma,

original: Bandhumatī nāma devī mātā ahosi janetti.
analyzed: bandhumatī nāma devī mātā
translated: and his mother was Queen Bandhumati.

original: Bandhumassa rañño bandhumatī nāma nagaraṁ rājadhānī ahosi.
analyzed: bandhumassa raññaḥ bandhumatī nāma nagaram rājadhānī ahosi
translated: King Bandhuma’s capital was the city of Bandhumati.

original: Vipassissa, mārisā, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa evaṁ abhinikkhamanaṁ ahosi evaṁ pabbajjā evaṁ padhānaṁ evaṁ abhisambodhi evaṁ dhammacakkappavattanaṁ.
analyzed: vipassissa mārisā bhagavataḥ arahataḥ sammāsambuddhassa evam abhinikkhamanam ahosi evam pabbajjā evam padhānam evam abhisambodhi evam dhamma cakka ppavattana
translated: Vipassī’s renunciation, going forth, and striving were the same as the Tathagata’s now.

original: Te mayaṁ, mārisā, vipassimhi bhagavati brahmacariyaṁ caritvā kāmesu kāmacchandaṁ virājetvā idhūpapannā’ti …
analyzed: te maya mārisāḥ vipassimhi bhagavati brahmacariyam caritvā kāmesu kāmacchandam virājetvā idhu upapannā ati
translated: And we, having practiced the spiritual life under the Blessed One Vipassī, having abandoned sensual desire for sensual pleasures, were reborn here.’

original: pe…
analyzed: pe

original: Tasmiṁyeva kho, bhikkhave, devanikāye anekāni devatāsahassāni anekāni devatāsatasahassāni
analyzed: tasmiya eva kho bhikkhave devanikāye anekāni devatā sahassāni anekāni devatā sata sahassāni
translated: In that same host of gods there were many thousands of gods, many hundreds of thousands of gods

original: yenāhaṁ tenupasaṅkamiṁsu; upasaṅkamitvā maṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ aṭṭhaṁsu. Ekamantaṁ
analyzed: yena aham tena upasaṅkamisu upasaṅkamitvā mam abhivādetvā ekamantam aṭṭhasu ekamanta
translated: who approached me, and after approaching and worshipping me, they stood at one side.

original: ṭhitā kho, bhikkhave, tā devatā maṁ etadavocuṁ:
analyzed: ṭhitāḥ kho bhikkhave tāḥ devatāḥ mama etat avocuḥ
translated: While standing at one side, those gods said this to me:

original: ‘imasmiṁyeva kho, mārisā, bhaddakappe bhagavā etarahi arahaṁ sammāsambuddho loke uppanno.
analyzed: imasmiya eva kho mārisā bhaddakappe bhagavā etarahi araham sammāsambuddhaḥ loke uppannaḥ
translated: ‘In this very fortunate aeon, dear Sirs, the Blessed One, the Worthy One, the Perfect Sambuddha has arisen in the world.

original: Bhagavā, mārisā, khattiyo jātiyā khattiyakule uppanno.
analyzed: bhagavā mārisā khattiyaḥ jātiyā khattiya kule uppannaḥ
translated: The Blessed One, dear Sirs, is a noble by birth, he has arisen in a noble family.

original: Bhagavā, mārisā, gotamo gottena.
analyzed: bhagavā mārisāḥ gotamaḥ gottena
translated: The Blessed One, dear Sirs, is of the Gotama family.

original: Bhagavato, mārisā, appakaṁ āyuppamāṇaṁ parittaṁ lahukaṁ yo ciraṁ jīvati, so vassasataṁ appaṁ vā bhiyyo.
analyzed: bhagavataḥ mārisāḥ appakam āyu ppamāṇam parittam lahukam yaḥ ciram jīvati saḥ vassa satam appam vā bhiyyas
translated: Your majesty, the Blessed Lord’s life was short, only a hundred years, or a little more.

original: Bhagavā, mārisā, assatthassa mūle abhisambuddho.🔽Bhagavato, mārisā, sāriputtamoggallānaṁ nāma sāvakayugaṁ ahosi aggaṁ bhaddayugaṁ.
analyzed: bhagavā mārisā assatthassa mūle abhisambuddhaḥ  bhagavataḥ mārisā sāriputta moggallānam nāma sāvaka yugam ahosi aggam bhadda yuga
translated: Your majesty, the Blessed Lord was enlightened at the foot of the Bodhi tree.🔽Your majesty, the Blessed Lord had a pair of chief disciples named Sariputta and Moggallana.

original: Bhagavato, mārisā, eko sāvakānaṁ sannipāto ahosi aḍḍhateḷasāni bhikkhusatāni. Bhagavato, mārisā, ayaṁ eko sāvakānaṁ sannipāto ahosi sabbesaṁyeva khīṇāsavānaṁ.
analyzed: bhagavataḥ mārisā ekaḥ sāvakānam sannipātaḥ ahosi aḍḍhateḷasāni bhikkhu satāni bhagavataḥ mārisā ayam ekaḥ sāvakānam sannipātaḥ ahosi
translated: Your majesty, the Blessed Lord had one assembly of disciples, one hundred and twenty thousand monks, all of them Arahants.

original: Bhagavato, mārisā, ānando nāma bhikkhu upaṭṭhāko ahosi aggupaṭṭhāko.
analyzed: bhagavataḥ mārisā ānandaḥ nāma bhikkhu upaṭṭhākaḥ ahosi aggupaṭṭhāko
translated: Your majesty, the Blessed Lord’s attendant monk was Ananda.

original: Bhagavato, mārisā, suddhodano nāma rājā pitā ahosi.
analyzed: bhagavataḥ mārisā suddhodanaḥ nāma rājā pitā ahosi
translated: Your majesty, the Blessed Lord’s father was King Suddhodana.

original: Māyā nāma devī mātā ahosi janetti.
analyzed: māyā nāma devī mātā ahosi jana itti
translated: His mother was Queen Maya, who died seven days after his birth, when he was taken to his aunt Mahapajapati Gotami to bring him up.

original: Kapilavatthu nāma nagaraṁ rājadhānī ahosi.
analyzed: kapilavatthu nāma nagaram rājadhānī ahosi
translated: Your majesty, the capital was Kapilavatthu.

original: Bhagavato, mārisā, evaṁ abhinikkhamanaṁ ahosi evaṁ pabbajjā evaṁ padhānaṁ evaṁ abhisambodhi evaṁ dhammacakkappavattanaṁ.
analyzed: bhagavataḥ mārisā evam abhinikkhamanam ahosi evam pabbajjā evam padhānam evam abhisambodhi evam dhamma cakka ppavattana
translated: ‘Our lord, sirs, went forth from the Sakyans in such a way, he became a monk in such a way, he undertook austerities in such a way, he came to the supreme full attainment of the true way in such a way, he set rolling the wheel of the Teaching in such a way.

original: Te mayaṁ, mārisā, bhagavati brahmacariyaṁ caritvā kāmesu kāmacchandaṁ virājetvā idhūpapannā’ti.
analyzed: te mārisāḥ bhagavati brahmacariyam caritvā kāmesu kāmacchandam virājetvā idhu upapannā ati
translated: And we, sirs, having lived the holy life under the Lord, having renounced sensual desire, have been reborn here.’

original: Atha khvāhaṁ, bhikkhave, avihehi devehi saddhiṁ yena atappā devā tenupasaṅkamiṁ …pe…🔽atha khvāhaṁ, bhikkhave, avihehi ca devehi atappehi ca devehi saddhiṁ yena sudassā devā tenupasaṅkamiṁ.🔽Atha khvāhaṁ, bhikkhave, avihehi ca devehi atappehi ca devehi sudassehi ca devehi
analyzed: atha khvā āha bhikkhave avihehi devehi saddhim yena atappā devā tena upasaṅkamim pe  atha khvā āha bhikkhave avihehi ca devehi atappehi ca devehi saddhim yena sudassā devā tena upasaṅkami  atha khvā āha bhikkhave avihehi ca devehi atappehi ca devehi sudassehi ca devehi
translated: Then, monks, together with the Aviha devas I approached the Atappa devas …🔽Then, monks, together with the Aviha and Atappa devas I approached the Sudassa devas …🔽Then, monks, together with the Aviha, Atappa and Sudassa devas

original: saddhiṁ yena sudassī devā tenupasaṅkamiṁ. Atha khvāhaṁ, bhikkhave, avihehi ca devehi🔽atappehi ca devehi sudassehi ca devehi sudassīhi ca devehi saddhiṁ yena akaniṭṭhā
analyzed: saddhim yena sudassī devā tena upasaṅkami atha khvā āha bhikkhave avihehi ca devehi 🔽atappehi ca devehi sudassehi ca devehi sudassīhi ca devehi saddhim yena a kaniṭṭhā
translated: I approached the Sudassi devas. Then, monks, together with the Aviha, Atappa, Sudassa and Sudassi devas🔽I approached the Akanittha devas.

original: devā tenupasaṅkamiṁ. Tasmiṁ, bhikkhave, devanikāye anekāni devatāsahassāni anekāni🔽devatāsatasahassāni yenāhaṁ tenupasaṅkamiṁsu, upasaṅkamitvā maṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ
analyzed: devā tena upasaṅkami tasmi bhikkhave devanikāye anekāni devatā sahassāni anekāni  devatā sata sahassāni yena aham tena upasaṅkamisu upasaṅkamitvā mama abhivādetvā ekamanta
translated: I went to them. Many thousands of gods,🔽many hundreds of thousands of gods went to me, bowed down,

original: aṭṭhaṁsu. Ekamantaṁ ṭhitā kho, bhikkhave, tā devatā maṁ etadavocuṁ:
analyzed: aṭṭhasu ekamantam ṭhitāḥ kho bhikkhave tāḥ devatāḥ mama etat avocuḥ
translated: and stood to one side. The gods said to me:

original: ‘ito so, mārisā, ekanavutikappe yaṁ vipassī bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho loke udapādi.
analyzed: itas saḥ mārisāḥ ekanavuti kappe yam vipassī bhagavā araham sammāsambuddhaḥ loke udapādi
translated: ‘Good sir, ninety-one eons ago the Buddha Vipassī, accomplished and fully awakened, arose in the world.

original: Vipassī, mārisā, bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho khattiyo jātiyā ahosi.
analyzed: vipassī mārisā bhagavā araham sammāsambuddhaḥ khattiyaḥ jātiyā ahosi
translated: The Buddha Vipassī was born into a khattiya clan.

original: Khattiyakule udapādi.
analyzed: khattiya kule udapādi
translated: He arose in a khattiya clan.

original: Vipassī, mārisā, bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho koṇḍañño gottena ahosi.
analyzed: vipassī mārisā bhagavā araham sammāsambuddhaḥ koṇḍaññaḥ gottena ahosi
translated: The Buddha Vipassī was of the Kondanna clan.

original: Vipassissa, mārisā, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa asītivassasahassāni āyuppamāṇaṁ ahosi.
analyzed: vipassissa mārisā bhagavataḥ arahataḥ sammāsambuddhassa asīti vassa sahassāni āyu ppamāṇam ahosi
translated: The Buddha Vipassī’s lifespan was 80,000 years.

original: Vipassī, mārisā, bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho pāṭaliyā mūle abhisambuddho.
analyzed: vipassī mārisā bhagavā araham sammāsambuddhaḥ pāṭaliyā mūle abhisambuddhaḥ
translated: The Buddha Vipassī was awakened at the foot of a pāṭali tree.

original: Vipassissa, mārisā, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa khaṇḍatissaṁ nāma sāvakayugaṁ ahosi aggaṁ bhaddayugaṁ.🔽Vipassissa, mārisā, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa tayo sāvakānaṁ sannipātā ahesuṁ.
analyzed: vipassissa mārisā bhagavataḥ arahataḥ sammāsambuddhassa khaṇḍatissam nāma sāvaka yugam ahosi aggam bhadda yuga  vipassissa mārisāḥ bhagavataḥ arahataḥ sammāsambuddhassa tayo sāvakānam sannipātāḥ ahesu
translated: Vipassi’s chief disciples were the monks named Khaṇḍa and Tissa.

original: Eko sāvakānaṁ sannipāto ahosi aṭṭhasaṭṭhibhikkhusatasahassaṁ.🔽Eko sāvakānaṁ sannipāto ahosi bhikkhusatasahassaṁ.🔽Eko sāvakānaṁ sannipāto ahosi asītibhikkhusahassāni.🔽Vipassissa, mārisā, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa ime tayo sāvakānaṁ sannipātā ahesuṁ sabbesaṁyeva khīṇāsavānaṁ.
analyzed: ekaḥ sāvakānam sannipātaḥ ahosi aṭṭhasaṭṭhi bhikkhu sata sahassa  ekaḥ sāvakānam sannipātaḥ ahosi bhikkhu sata sahassa  ekaḥ sāvakānam sannipātaḥ ahosi asīti bhikkhu sahassāni  vipassissa mārisāḥ bhagavataḥ arahataḥ sammāsambuddhassa ime tayo sāvakānam sannipātāḥ ahesum khīṇa asavānam
translated: Vipassi had three assemblies of his disciples: one of a hundred thousand, one of eighty thousand, and one of seventy thousand monks, all of them arahants.

original: Vipassissa, mārisā, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa asoko nāma bhikkhu upaṭṭhāko ahosi aggupaṭṭhāko.
analyzed: vipassissa mārisā bhagavataḥ arahataḥ sammāsambuddhassa asokaḥ nāma bhikkhu upaṭṭhākaḥ ahosi aggupaṭṭhāko
translated: Vipassi’s chief personal attendant was the monk named Asoka.

original: Vipassissa, mārisā, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa bandhumā nāma rājā pitā ahosi bandhumatī nāma devī mātā ahosi janetti.
analyzed: vipassissa mārisā bhagavataḥ arahataḥ sammāsambuddhassa bandhumā nāma rājā pitā ahosi bandhumatī nāma devī mātā ahosi janetti
translated: Vipassi’s father was Bandhuma, a king of Bandhumati.

original: Bandhumassa rañño bandhumatī nāma nagaraṁ rājadhānī ahosi.🔽Vipassissa, mārisā, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa evaṁ abhinikkhamanaṁ ahosi evaṁ pabbajjā evaṁ padhānaṁ evaṁ abhisambodhi, evaṁ dhammacakkappavattanaṁ.
analyzed: bandhumassa raññaḥ bandhumatī nāma nagaram rājadhānī ahosi  vipassissa mārisā bhagavataḥ arahataḥ sammāsambuddhassa evam abhinikkhamanam ahosi evam pabbajjā evam padhānam evam abhisambodhi evam dhamma cakka ppavattana
translated: His mother was Queen Bandhumati, and he was born Prince AnomadassI.🔽He went forth from the home life into homelessness, and by his own unaided efforts he fully awakened to the truth.

original: Te mayaṁ, mārisā, vipassimhi bhagavati brahmacariyaṁ caritvā kāmesu kāmacchandaṁ virājetvā idhūpapannā’ti.
analyzed: te maya mārisāḥ vipassimhi bhagavati brahmacariyam caritvā kāmesu kāmacchandam virājetvā idhu upapannā ati
translated: And we, having lived the holy life under the Blessed One Vipassi, having abandoned sensual desire for sensual pleasures, have been reborn here.’

original: Tasmiṁyeva kho, bhikkhave, devanikāye anekāni devatāsahassāni anekāni devatāsatasahassāni
analyzed: tasmiya eva kho bhikkhave devanikāye anekāni devatā sahassāni anekāni devatā sata sahassāni
translated: In that same host of gods there were many thousands of deities, many hundreds of thousands of deities,

original: yenāhaṁ tenupasaṅkamiṁsu; upasaṅkamitvā maṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ aṭṭhaṁsu. Ekamantaṁ
analyzed: yena aham tena upasaṅkamisu upasaṅkamitvā mam abhivādetvā ekamantam aṭṭhasu ekamanta
translated: who approached me, and after approaching and worshipping me, they stood at one side.

original: ṭhitā kho, bhikkhave, tā devatā maṁ etadavocuṁ:
analyzed: ṭhitāḥ kho bhikkhave tāḥ devatāḥ mama etat avocuḥ
translated: While standing at one side, those deities said this to me:

original: ‘ito so, mārisā, ekatiṁse kappe yaṁ sikhī bhagavā …pe…🔽te mayaṁ, mārisā, sikhimhi bhagavati tasmiññeva kho, mārisā, ekatiṁse kappe yaṁ vessabhū bhagavā …pe…
analyzed: itas saḥ mārisāḥ ekatise kappe yam sikhī bhagavā pe  te mārisāḥ sikhimhi bhagavati tasmin ñeva kho mārisāḥ ekatise kappe yam vessabhū bhagavā pe
translated: ‘Sirs, thirty-one eons ago, there was a Buddha named Sikhī …🔽Sirs, in that same eon, thirty-one eons ago, there was a Buddha named Vessabhū …

original: te mayaṁ, mārisā, vessabhumhi bhagavati …pe…
analyzed: te mārisā vessabhumhi bhagavati pe
translated: Sirs, in that same eon, thirty-one eons ago, there was a Buddha named Kakusandha …

original: imasmiṁyeva kho, mārisā, bhaddakappe kakusandho koṇāgamano kassapo bhagavā …pe…
analyzed: imasmiya eva kho mārisāḥ bhaddakappe kakusandhaḥ koṇāgamanaḥ kassapaḥ bhagavā pe
translated: Sirs, in this fortunate eon, there was a Buddha named Kakusandha, Koṇāgamana, Kassapa …

original: te mayaṁ, mārisā, kakusandhamhi koṇāgamanamhi kassapamhi bhagavati brahmacariyaṁ caritvā kāmesu kāmacchandaṁ virājetvā idhūpapannā’ti.
analyzed: te maya mārisā kakusandhamhi koṇāgamanamhi kassapamhi bhagavati brahmacariyam caritvā kāmesu kāmacchandam virājetvā idhu upapannā ati
translated: Sirs, we practiced the spiritual life under Kakusandha, Koṇāgamana, and Kassapa, the Perfected and Fully Awakened Ones. We gave up our desire for sensual pleasures and were reborn here.’

original: Tasmiṁyeva kho, bhikkhave, devanikāye anekāni devatāsahassāni anekāni devatāsatasahassāni
analyzed: tasmiya eva kho bhikkhave devanikāye anekāni devatā sahassāni anekāni devatā sata sahassāni
translated: In that gathering of gods there were many thousands of gods, many hundreds of thousands of gods

original: yenāhaṁ tenupasaṅkamiṁsu; upasaṅkamitvā maṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ aṭṭhaṁsu. Ekamantaṁ
analyzed: yena aham tena upasaṅkamisu upasaṅkamitvā mam abhivādetvā ekamantam aṭṭhasu ekamanta
translated: who approached me, bowed, and stood to one side.

original: ṭhitā kho, bhikkhave, tā devatā maṁ etadavocuṁ:
analyzed: ṭhitāḥ kho bhikkhave tāḥ devatāḥ mama etat avocuḥ
translated: They said to me:

original: ‘imasmiṁyeva kho, mārisā, bhaddakappe bhagavā etarahi arahaṁ sammāsambuddho loke uppanno.
analyzed: imasmiya eva kho mārisā bhaddakappe bhagavā etarahi araham sammāsambuddhaḥ loke uppannaḥ
translated: ‘In this very auspicious aeon, sirs, the Blessed One, the Worthy One, the Perfect Sambuddha has arisen in the world.

original: Bhagavā, mārisā, khattiyo jātiyā, khattiyakule uppanno.
analyzed: bhagavā mārisā khattiyaḥ jātiyā khattiya kule uppannaḥ
translated: The Blessed One, sirs, is by birth a noble, arisen in a noble family.

original: Bhagavā, mārisā, gotamo gottena.
analyzed: bhagavā mārisāḥ gotamaḥ gottena
translated: The Blessed One, sirs, is of the Gotama family.

original: Bhagavato, mārisā, appakaṁ āyuppamāṇaṁ parittaṁ lahukaṁ yo ciraṁ jīvati, so vassasataṁ appaṁ vā bhiyyo.
analyzed: bhagavataḥ mārisāḥ appakam āyu ppamāṇam parittam lahukam yaḥ ciram jīvati saḥ vassa satam appam vā bhiyyas
translated: The Blessed One, sirs, has a short life-span, a short time (here), a short (span of) life, he who lives long lives a hundred years or a little more.

original: Bhagavā, mārisā, assatthassa mūle abhisambuddho.
analyzed: bhagavā mārisā assatthassa mūle abhisambuddhaḥ
translated: The Blessed One, sirs, was Awakened at the foot of an Assattha tree.

original: Bhagavato, mārisā, sāriputtamoggallānaṁ nāma sāvakayugaṁ ahosi aggaṁ bhaddayugaṁ.🔽Bhagavato, mārisā, eko sāvakānaṁ sannipāto ahosi aḍḍhateḷasāni bhikkhusatāni.
analyzed: bhagavataḥ mārisā sāriputta moggallānam nāma sāvaka yugam ahosi aggam bhadda yuga  bhagavataḥ mārisāḥ ekaḥ sāvakānam sannipātaḥ ahosi aḍḍhateḷasāni bhikkhu satāni
translated: The Blessed One, sirs, had a pair of chief disciples named Sāriputta and Moggallāna.🔽The Blessed One, sirs, had one assembly of disciples - one and a half times one hundred and eighty disciples.

original: Bhagavato, mārisā, ayaṁ eko sāvakānaṁ sannipāto ahosi sabbesaṁyeva khīṇāsavānaṁ.
analyzed: bhagavataḥ mārisāḥ ayam ekaḥ sāvakānam sannipātaḥ ahosi
translated: The Blessed One, sirs, had this one assembly of disciples, all of whom were Worthy.

original: Bhagavato, mārisā, ānando nāma bhikkhu upaṭṭhāko aggupaṭṭhāko ahosi.
analyzed: bhagavataḥ mārisā ānandaḥ nāma bhikkhu upaṭṭhākaḥ aggupaṭṭhāko ahosi
translated: The Blessed One, sirs, had a monk named Ānanda as his attendant, a chief attendant.

original: Bhagavato, mārisā, suddhodano nāma rājā pitā ahosi.
analyzed: bhagavataḥ mārisā suddhodanaḥ nāma rājā pitā ahosi
translated: The Blessed One, sirs, had a father named Suddhodana, a king.

original: Māyā nāma devī mātā ahosi janetti.
analyzed: māyā nāma devī mātā ahosi jana itti
translated: Queen Maya was the mother who bore him.

original: Kapilavatthu nāma nagaraṁ rājadhānī ahosi.
analyzed: kapilavatthu nāma nagaram rājadhānī ahosi
translated: Kapilavatthu was his capital.

original: Bhagavato, mārisā, evaṁ abhinikkhamanaṁ ahosi, evaṁ pabbajjā, evaṁ padhānaṁ, evaṁ abhisambodhi, evaṁ dhammacakkappavattanaṁ.
analyzed: bhagavataḥ mārisā evam abhinikkhamanam ahosi evam pabbajjā evam padhāna evam abhisambodhi evam dhamma cakka ppavattana
translated: ‘This, Prince, was the way of renunciation, the way of the homeless life, the way of purity, that the Blessed One went forth on.

original: Te mayaṁ, mārisā, bhagavati brahmacariyaṁ caritvā kāmesu kāmacchandaṁ virājetvā idhūpapannā’ti.
analyzed: te mārisāḥ bhagavati brahmacariyam caritvā kāmesu kāmacchandam virājetvā idhu upapannā ati
translated: And we, Prince, having lived the holy life under the Blessed One, having abandoned lust, hatred and delusion, have been reborn here.’🔽‘Thus, monks, the Tathagata has penetrated the Dhamma-element,

original: Iti kho, bhikkhave, tathāgatassevesā dhammadhātu suppaṭividdhā, yassā dhammadhātuyā🔽suppaṭividdhattā tathāgato atīte buddhe parinibbute chinnapapañce chinnavaṭume pariyādinnavaṭṭe🔽sabbadukkhavītivatte jātitopi anussarati, nāmatopi anussarati, gottatopi anussarati,🔽āyuppamāṇatopi anussarati, sāvakayugatopi anussarati, sāvakasannipātatopi anussarati
analyzed: iti kho bhikkhave tathāgatassa iva īsā dhammadhātu su paṭividdhā yassā dhammadhātuyā  suppaṭividdha ttā tathāgataḥ atīte buddhe parinibbute chinna papañce chinna vaṭume pariyādinna vaṭṭe  sabba dukkha vītivatte jātitaḥ api anussarati nāmataḥ api anussarati gottataḥ api anussarati  āyu ppamāṇataḥ api anussarati sāvaka yugataḥ api anussarati sāvaka sannipātataḥ api anussarati
translated: and by the penetration of the Dhamma-element the Tathagata recalls many previous existences.🔽That is to say: one birth, two births, three births, four births, five births, ten births, twenty births, thirty births, forty births, fifty births,🔽a hundred births, a thousand births, a hundred thousand births,🔽many aeons of world-contraction, many aeons of world-expansion, many aeons of world-contraction and expansion: “There I was so named, of such a race, with such an appearance, such was my food, such my experience of pleasure and pain, such my life-term;

original: ‘evaṁjaccā te bhagavanto ahesuṁ’ itipi.
analyzed: te bhagavantaḥ ahesu iti pi
translated: and passing away from there, I reappeared elsewhere; and there too I was so named, of such a race, with such an appearance, such was my food, such my experience of pleasure and pain, such my life-term; and passing away from there, I reappeared here.” Thus with its aspects and particulars he recalls his manifold past existences.’

original: ‘Evaṁnāmā evaṅgottā evaṁsīlā evaṁdhammā evaṁpaññā evaṁvihārī evaṁvimuttā te bhagavanto ahesuṁ’ itipīti.
analyzed: eva nāmā evaṃgottā eva sīlā eva dhammā eva paññā eva vihārī eva vimuttā te bhagavantaḥ ahesu iti pi iti
translated: ‘They were called thus, they were of such a lineage, such was their morality, such their Dhamma, such their wisdom, such their life, such their freedom,’

original: Devatāpi tathāgatassa etamatthaṁ ārocesuṁ, yena tathāgato atīte buddhe parinibbute🔽chinnapapañce chinnavaṭume pariyādinnavaṭṭe sabbadukkhavītivatte jātitopi anussarati,
analyzed: devatā api tathāgatassa etam attham ārocesu yena tathāgataḥ atīte buddhe parinibbute  chinna papañce chinna vaṭume pariyādinna vaṭṭe sabba dukkha vītivatte jātitaḥ api anussarati
translated: and the devas told the Realised One this matter, by which the Realised One remembers the Buddhas of the past who have attained Complete Emancipation,🔽who have cut off the possibility of rebirth, cut off the possibility of continuation, cut off the possibility of existence, cut off the possibility of arising, and gone to final Nibbāna,

original: nāmatopi anussarati, gottatopi anussarati, āyuppamāṇatopi anussarati, sāvakayugatopi🔽anussarati, sāvakasannipātatopi anussarati ‘evaṁjaccā te bhagavanto ahesuṁ’ itipi.
analyzed: nāmataḥ api anussarati gottataḥ api anussarati āyu ppamāṇataḥ api anussarati sāvaka yugataḥ api  anussarati sāvaka sannipātataḥ pi anussarati evajaccā te bhagavantaḥ ahesu iti pi
translated: he remembers their births, he remembers their names and clans, he remembers their life-span, he remembers their assemblies of disciples, he remembers their chief disciples,

original: ‘Evaṁnāmā evaṅgottā evaṁsīlā evaṁdhammā evaṁpaññā evaṁvihārī evaṁvimuttā te bhagavanto ahesuṁ’ itipī”ti.
analyzed: eva nāmā evaṃgottā eva sīlā eva dhammā eva paññā eva vihārī eva vimuttā te bhagavantaḥ ahesu iti pi iti
translated: he remembers their attendants, he remembers their good friends, he remembers their good companions, he remembers their good comrades, he remembers their going forth, he remembers their full acceptance, he remembers their Dhamma, he remembers their Pātimokkha, he remembers their morality, he remembers their wisdom, he remembers their freedom, he remembers their great freedom.’

original: Idamavoca bhagavā.
analyzed: idam avoca bhagavān
translated: This is what the Fortunate One said,

original: Attamanā te bhikkhū bhagavato bhāsitaṁ abhinandunti.
analyzed: attamanāḥ te bhikkhū bhagavataḥ bhāsitam abhinandunti
translated: and after saying this, the Realised One, the Teacher, said something more:

original: Mahāpadānasuttaṁ niṭṭhitaṁ paṭhamaṁ.
analyzed: mahāpadāna suttam niṭṭhitam paṭhama
translated: The Great Discourse on the Lineage is finished.
